To date, everything is going very well.  She sees how her production increases every day and she earns positive economic profits.

This will be her third Kiva loan and she’s very happy to know that she’ll have financial support because she’ll feel surer of making progress with her business.  She commits to pay her installments punctually.  She will use the requested 800 soles to buy business supplies like fabric, thread and elastic, among others.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Fien

texts.en:
She is married and has six children. The family lives in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, such as sickness in her family, inadequate financing to properly manage her business, deaths of family loved ones, early marriage and dropping out of school by her children because she could not afford their schooling.

She has taken and repaid a loan successfully one time before. She says that with the new loan she will buy seeds, including sweet yam and bean seeds, plus manure for fertilizer. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding, because she has been farming for a long time. She has regular customers who buy her farm produce from her. She also supplies quality goods that cannot easily be destroyed. With this business activity, the community will have a regular supply of food, at reduced prices. She will also encourage many women to join farming.

GHAPE loans are preferable to her, because of the low interest rate, the convenient repayment interval, the trainings offered to GHAPE members before a loan is given, and the follow-up of the loan, which makes members work hard.

loans.use: to buy seeds, including sweet yam and bean seeds, and manure for fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
Ma. Rowena is a married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old. Ma. Rowena has a business, buying and selling ladies' accessories, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 22 years.

Ma. Rowena requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to purchase more accessories to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' accessories to sell

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчон скотовод и житель горного района Вахш. Ему 34 года. Он женат и у него двухлетняя дочь и четырехлетний сын. Он живет в доме отца. Махаммадчон зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он обычно закупает бычков, выгуливает их на местном пастбище и после двух месяца откорма продает на скотном рынке района. Мухаммадчон занимается купле-продажей скота более 4-х лет и этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он запрашивает кредит для своей животноводческой деятельности с целью увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота.
texts.en: Muhammadjon is a cattle breeder who lives in the mountainous region of Vakhsh. He is 34 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter and a four-year-old son. He lives with his father and earns a living breeding cattle. He usually buys calves, turns them out to pasture, and, after fattening them up for two months, sells them at the local cattle market. Muhammadjon has been buying and reselling cattle for more than four years, which is his family's only source of income. He is asking for a loan for his livestock business in order to sell more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa con sus padres es madre soltera tiene una hija de 1 año de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su casa, la clienta solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor y poder surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hija lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client lives with her parents.  She is a single mother, and she has a one year old daughter.  She sells clothes and shoes close to where she lives.  With the earnings that she gets she helps with the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale.  This way she will be able to stock her business in order to get better earnings to give her daughter what she needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gina has been farming rice for six years, and she earns additional income by buying and selling nipa, which are woven palm mats used for house repair and construction.

Gina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy fertilizers and other rice farming supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other rice farming supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Maria has requested to borrow PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Gorgonia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, who are currently going to school, Gorgonia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling Avon products. Gorgonia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

Gorgonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her restuarant business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old, married, and has two children. With one child currently in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, rice, bread and other groceries. 

Amalia has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy more inventory for her store. She would like to save enough money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store, such as soap, shampoo, soft drinks, rice, bread and other groceries

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El señor José Ramón vive en  Managua, labora para el estado como conserje desde hace catorce años, su estado civil es casado, tiene  tres personas  bajo su cargo, con buenos valores morales, es una persona luchadora para el bienestar de su familia.
 
Don José Ramón  se presento a Ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la construcción de un anexo de un cuarto, este crédito será invertido en compra de cemento, bloque, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra. 

Espera que le sigan dando la mano amigable en estos pequeños créditos que tanto ayuda en el desarrollo de la familia con muchos deseos de vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
José Ramón lives in Managua and has worked for the State as a janitor for 14 years. He is married and is responsible for 3 people. He has good moral values and is a person who strives for the wellbeing of his family.

José Ramón approached Ceprodel to ask for finance to build a one-room add-on. The loan will be used to purchase cement, cinder blocks, sand and iron and to pay for labour.

He hopes they will continue to give him a helping hand with these small loans which are a great help to the family, who really want to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 41 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for three years, and she earns additional income by selling charcoal and cultivating rice.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to resell at her general store, like chips, soap, shampoo, canned goods and eggs. Carina has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to resell at her general store, like chips, soap, shampoo, canned goods and eggs.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food preparation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her prepared food business.

Generosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don Salvador vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Don Salvador solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas asi como muestra la fotografía para tener buenas cosechas y así el pueda obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Salvador lives with his partner and their two children in a house they own. He has been growing corn and sorghum for several years. This has given him enough experience to take care of his planting. Salvador sells his crops in markets of basic grain near his home. He uses the profits to take care of the household expenses.
Salvador is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as chemical fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc, such as you can see in the picture. Like this, he can get good crops and increase profit so he can provide more economical stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers, manure, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale soil to make mud

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a food stall in the Philippines for the past two years. Susan has requested a PHP 18500 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food business, and in the future would like to build and expand her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rodha

texts.en:
Rodha is a hard-working woman, living in Taiz, Yemen. She is a 29-year-old, single woman. She is a teacher getting a low salary, which is not enough to cover her expenses. 

Rodha is requesting a youth loan for YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy home appliances. She hopes to open a retail shop to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Siosen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Siosen works hard to support her family. She is engaged in business, buying and selling ginger in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending and cultivating vegetables. 

Siosen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to purchase additional sacks of ginger to resell. Siosen has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of ginger to resell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 46 years old, married, and a mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, preparing and selling food, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Mary Grace requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan capital to buy ingredients for her food business. She would like to save enough money to expand her business, and continue to send her children to college, in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, a 58-year-old married mother of two, earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines, an enterprise she has had for 10 years. She also earns income from poultry. Delia is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs as she works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan,  tiene 56 años de edad, vive con su esposa de 50 años de edad y con sus tres hijos los cuales tiene edades de 11, 16 y 18 años. El se dedica a  las actividades agropecuarias tales como: frijol y maíz, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y lo ha desempeñado toda su vida, ya que es su principal actividad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas; este le ayudara a incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que aprendan a trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Juan is 56 years old and lives with his wife who is 50 and his 3 children aged 11, 16 and 18. He earns a living from growing crops such as beans and corn. This is his main occupation and he has done this all his life, having learnt the skills from his father.

The loan he is requesting will allow him to buy the necessary agricultural supplies such as fertiliser, weedkiller, pesticides, insecticides, and fungicides. This will help him to increase his production and improve his family's quality of life. His dream is for his children to be able to study and to learn how to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, weedkiller, pesticides, insecticides, and fungicides.

loans.name: Paquix De Jutacaj Group

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia es casada, cuenta con 32 años de edad, curso 2 años de educacion primaria, tiene 5 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a crianza de animales domésticos, inició este negocio con 1 docena de pollos y 1 cerdito y hasta la fecha lleva 8 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un prupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de 5 docenas de pollos y 4 cerditos para criarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro desea contar con una granja grande de pollos y cerdos, los demás integrantes del grupo se dedian a comercio artesanía y pecuario.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 32 years old and has 2 years of primary education. She is married with 5 children and 4 of them are in school. She earns a living rearing domesticated animals. She started her business with a dozen chickens and a piglet and now has 8 years' experience. She gets help from her husband who works in business. 

Anastacia is the organiser of a group and is asking for a loan which she will use to buy 5 dozen chickens and 4 piglets to raise for selling later on. In the future she wants to have a large chicken and pig farm.

The other members of the group earn a living selling crafts and in livestock.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 53 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general store) in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years, and she earns additional income by fattening pigs.

Nelly has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her sari-sari store, like shampoo and groceries. She has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF, before this loan. Nelly aspires to save enough money, to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her sari-sari store, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 40 years old and married with three children.

Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, eggs, etc.

Belinda has borrowed and paid fifteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Belinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Om-Ghadar Group

texts.en:
Om-Ghadar Group is a four-member group. All of them are poor women from Taiz, Yemen. Collectively, they applied for a YER 160,000 loan from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to renovate their house. 

Nama is a 43-year-old married woman and has eleven children. She is the leader of the group. She is uneducated, living in a poor area in Taiz. Her house is very old and in a miserable situation. She has accumulated some money to renovate her house. It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money. She has started renovating her house, but now she is short of money. 

She needs to complete the renovation task, so she asked for a loan of YER 40,000 to buy cement and carpentry materials. She hopes that, after the completion of the house renovation, she can start accumulating money to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cement and carpentry materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Bashir Group

texts.en: This group is called Bashir and is made up of five women. They live in Taiz, Yemen, and have taken a loan of 120,000 YER. Atab is a 27-year-old woman. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of money. So, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to purchase home appliances for her house. Atab is the leader of the group, and she hopes to offer her family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Zidan Group

texts.en: This group is called Zidan, and it is comprised of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. Nagla is a 27-year-old, married woman, who has three children. She has been selling vegetables and fruits for one year. She is a responsible woman, and she works hard to earn daily income. Her business is not going well, due to a lack of money. To expand her business, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. Nagla hopes to enroll her children in private school and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to resell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Remedios is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase more items like diapers, shampoo, snack foods and other groceries for her general store business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like diapers, shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 39 years old and married with two children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, spices, noodles, legumes, etc.

Vilma has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Vilma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, spices, noodles, legumes, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 25 years old and married. She has one child who is in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Rowena would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
A divorced father of two, Simon lives with his children in a four-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. Simon has faced many problems in life, among which are the deaths of his mother and father when he could barely take care of himself, as well as his younger sister. Additionally, difficulties in single-handedly raising his two children who were abandoned by their mother when they were still young, their constant sickness, accidents that almost took his life, and poverty have proven to be real obstacles.

Having received and repaid several loans, Simon has requested a new one to expand his piggery farm by buying more piglets and constructing a fence for them. With the experience he has gained over the the past seven years, Simon is confident about obtaining maximum profit from the business, which provides the community with pigs used in ceremonial activities like marriage, birth and death celebrations.

With the profits from this loan, Simon will educate his children, provide three daily meals to his family, buy his children's medication and provide other necessities for them. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy piglets and construct a fence

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Susan successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Susan's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline is 39 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Marline is borrowing PHP 21,500 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Marline has been raising livestock for 13 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear and from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Abdufatto

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его зовут Абдуфатто.  Ему 41 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Так как он живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Он более 16  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Он так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Он хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who always tries to improve his living conditions and hopes for a bright future, needs financial support.  His name is Abdufatto.  He is 41 years old, married and raising four children.  Because he lives in a rural area, he has a good opportunity to develop his animal husbandry business.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 16 years and has an extensive experience in this business field.  He takes care of his livestock so well, as if he understands the language of his livestock.  Thanks to a good condition of his livestock, he has regular customers.  Abdufatto wants to develop his business and earn a larger income.  He plans to use the resulting income to improve his living conditions.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni to buy livestock.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
This time, Ma. Elena is applying for a new loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan to buy home care products to sell to her customers.  

Her business has been funded several times before by NWTF, and more recently by Kiva lenders, to enable her to provide an increased income for her family. Her goal in life is to build and expand her business, so that her family can have a secure future.

loans.use: to buy more home care products to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to save enough money so she can afford to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Al-Afrah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Afrah and is made up of three women who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB. 

Amna is a 36-year-old married woman with six children. They live in Taiz, Yemen. She is working hard to cover her family`s expenses. She is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for her home.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her home.

loans.name: Vianka Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras, una de ellas es Vianka mujer de 31 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos menores uno de 6 y 12 años de edad, su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas, posee una pequeña tienda de variedades  como es la venta de ropa, cosméticos, zapatos de dama y zapatos de varón, esta actividad tiene de ser propietaria cinco años, tiene tres años de ser cliente de la institución  por ser muy puntual  en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para hacer tortillas como maíz, cal, leña, en el crédito anterior logro cambiar el techo de su casa con las utilidades que le genero el negocio, Flor tiene 28 años su negocio es la venta de prendas de plata, ventas de sandalias, ropa nueva y ropa usada y Alba tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida, ropa nueva y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising partners. One of them is Vianka, a 31-year-old single mother of two children, ages 6 and 12. Her business is making and selling tortillas, and she also has a small variety store where she sells clothes, cosmetics, and men's and women's shoes. She has been the owner of this business for five years. 

She has been a client of the institution for three years, because she is very punctual with her payments. She will use the loan to buy raw materials to make tortillas, such as corn, lime, and firewood. With the last loan she was able to replace the roof of her house with the profits from the business.

Flor is 28 years old and sells silver jewelry, sandals, and new and used clothes. Alba is 35 years old and sells food, clothes, and shoes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as corn, lime, and firewood.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Mañana - 31 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento EMPRENDEDORAS DEL MAÑANA - 31, Está  compuesto por diez integrantes siete mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Giovanna tiene 24  años dos hijos de las edades de 4 y 5 años,  se dedica a la venta de perfumes y colonias y cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Giovanna va a usar este préstamo  para comprar perfumes y colonia por mayor que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Giovanna enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola, la Sra. Giovanna se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos al igual que ella sacan adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Emprendedoras del Mañana - 31 Communal Bank is made up of 10 members, seven women and three men.

The president of the bank is Giovanna.  She's 24 years old and has two children, ages 4 and 5.  She works making catalogue sales of perfume, cologne, and cosmetics.  She promotes beauty products.  She sells her products on foot, visiting public and private institutions and different neighborhoods and homes.

This loan is her third sequence with the institution.  Giovanna's going to use this loan to buy wholesale perfume and cologne that's on sale so she has stock for her business.  She's requesting the loan to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers.

The challenges Giovanna faces in her business are serving her customers efficiently.  She's going to use her profits to improve her family's quality of life, because this is the only job that lets her support herself and get ahead alone.

Giovanna is happy, and she's grateful to the institution for the help they've given to her and her colleagues because in many cases they get their families ahead, just as she does.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cologne wholesale

loans.name: Al-Moheeb Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Moheeb and consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Sabah is a 49-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small house.  She is applying for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction supplies. She aspires to buy a big house to live comfortably with her family. She is aiming to have the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole and open a savings account.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house

loans.name: Rhoda May

texts.en:
Rhoda May is 30 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rhoda May is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rhoda May has been farming vegetables for seven years and also earns additional income from dressmaking.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 40 and is married with three children. She lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province in Cambodia. For the last 16 years, Ny and her husband have been farming rice to provide the main source of their family’s income. Together, they can earn about 33,000 KHR daily and they manage to save about 15,000 KHR after their daily expenses. Ny has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and she has completely repaid her previous loan. 
 
Ny is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan with VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nancy Veronica

texts.es:
Nancy, vive con su familia, su mama de 60 años de edad, su esposo de 35 años de edad y su hijo de 10 años; todos dependen del negocio.  Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y posee una tienda de insumos para el hogar, el oficio de la tienda lo realiza todos los días de 6:00am hasta las 7:00pm mientras que las pupusas las elabora los  sábados y domingos por la tarde.
Nancy, solicita un préstamo, el cual le permitirá comprar maíz, frijoles,arroz, azucar, sal, papel higienico, golosinas, aceite, quesillo, repollo, chicharon, entre otros; este le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.
Su  sueño es que su hijo continúe estudiando   y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her family: her mother, 60 years old; her husband, 35 years old; and her son, 10 years old. All of them depend on the business. She sells pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and has a grocery store. She tends the store every day from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm, and she makes pupusas on Saturdays and Sundays in the afternoon. 

Nancy is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, candy, oil, cheese, cabbage, pork rinds, and other goods. This will help her strengthen her business and make a better income. Her dream is for her son to continue studying and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, salt, toilet paper, candy, oil, cheese, cabbage, pork rinds, and other goods.

loans.name: Nom's Group

texts.en:
Nom is 58 years old and married with six children. She is a villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. For the past 15 years, Nom has been a rice farmer, cultivating rice on a 2.5 hectare plot. She earns about 21,000 KHR each day to support her family. 
 
Nom is the leader of a group loan whose four members all live in the same village. She will use her portion of the loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farm. Nom has been with VisionFund for four cycles. In the future, Nom hopes that her loan will enable her to grow her rice on time and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern, 59, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has two children. 

For the last 18 years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day, and she can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Moern’s group consists of two members. She is a third-cycle client, while her group member is a first-cycle client. Moern successfully used the past loan to better support her family’s living. 

Now she and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 400,000 each. Moern wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Edolina

texts.en:
Edolina works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and she has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Edolina requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy materials, like fabrics and buttons, for her dressmaking business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to build her business further.

Edolina would like to save enough money to expand her business even more, in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials, like fabrics and buttons, for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: Yakeline tiene 29 años es casada con 2 hijos dependientes hace dos años es socia del grupo “HACIENDA CHACRASANA”  en el cual desempeña la función de secretaria. Yakeline se dedica al cuidado de niños en horas de la mañana y en las tardes brinda servicios de costura en su vivienda. Actividad que viene realizando hace muchos años. Años atrás vendía ropa en el mercado central de Lima. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina nueva de cocer. Su mayor deseo es construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Yakeline es la persona que tiene a su bebe en brazos.
texts.en:
Yakeline is 29. She is married with two dependent children. For two years she has been a member of the group "HACIENDA CHACRASANA", a group in which she fills the position of secretary. Yakeline works in child care in the mornings and in the afternoons she provides sewing services in her home. She has been involved in this occupation for many years. Years ago she used to sell clothing in Lima's central market. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a new baking machine. Her greatest wish is to build her own home. 

The group wishes to thank the KIVA investors for the loan that has been provided. Yakeline is the person who has a baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy a new baking machine

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat is 42 years old and married with three children. She is a citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district. For the past four years, Sinat has been a rice farmer who works hard to feed her family. She supplements her income by selling vegetables in a village. Sinat’s current business earns about 42,000 KHR each day and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sinat is the leader of a five-member female loan group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her land and to plow her field. Sinat has been with VisionFund for three cycles. In the future, she hopes to grow healthy rice and increase her family’s income to have a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her land and to plow her field

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Khun is 23 years old and married. To support her family, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland for five years. From the current business, she can earn about 11,000 KHR per day and can save about 3,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Khun’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she is a third-cycle client. The past loans have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Khun wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice in a timely manner so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Safarbeg

texts.ru: Сафарбегу 46 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Сафарбег имеет «золотые руки». Он более 25 лет занимается предоставлением услуги мастера по ремонту дома. Он очень опытный мастер. Сафарбег выполняет свою работу честно и качественно. Однако в последнее время он не имеет много заказов по ремонту дома как прежде. Он должен обеспечить семью и поэтому он решил уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для того, чтобы уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Safarbeg is 46 years old and he is married with four children at home.  He has a "golden hand" - for more than 25 years he has offered his services repairing homes.  Safarbeg is a very experienced repairman and he completes his work honestly and of a high quality.  However, he hasn't received many orders recently like he had before.  He needs to take care of his family and he has decided to leave for the Russian Federation.  He is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy plane tickets to Russia.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket to Russia

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Thoern, 33, lives with his family members in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. He has three dependent children. 

For the last ten years, he and his wife have been farming rice as the main source of their family’s income. The current business earns his family about KHR 25,000 per day. 

This is the third loan for Thoern with VisionFund. He completely paid back the past loans. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Thoern is going to use his portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to make more rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Mileydys

texts.es:
Mileydis está muy satisfecha con su credikiva, pues con él pudo comprar materiales para elaborar sus artesanías, las cuales vendió y satisfizo las necesidades de su clientela. Ahora está dedicada a la atención de su hijo y a su negocio totalmente,  pues ya no está empleada en una empresa y esto la mantiene muy contenta, porque además, puede ofrecerle a otros que están desempleados una posibilidad  de generar sus propios ingresos. 
Mileydis envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por el crédito que me ha beneficiado mucho mas personalmente y a nivel de mi familia“. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará materiales para tener un stock de artesanías, como piedras, cuarzos, cristales, hilos, pequeños trozos de madera,pegantes y pinturas, pues se acerca la temporada turística y con ella el mayor movimiento del año en sus ventas, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Mileydis is very happy with her Kiva loan as with it she was able to buy materials to make her artisan crafts.  She sold her craft work, satisfying her customers' needs.  Now Miyleydis is dedicating all her attention to her son and business as she is no longer working for another business.  She is happy with this as she is able to give other unemployed people the opportunity to earn an income.  Mileydis sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  "Thank you for the loan.  It has benefited my family and me greatly."  Mileydis is currently applying for a Kiva loan that she will use to buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, wire, small pieces of wood, glue, and paint. The tourist season is approaching and this is the high season for sales.  This will make her investment a success.

loans.use: to buy artisan materials like stones, quartz, glass, wire, small pieces of wood, glue, and paint.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio vive con su esposa en casa de su propiedad y sus cinco,  desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz, fríjol y maicillo con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía,  pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: Julio lives with his wife in their own house and his five children. He has been working in agriculture, which is their principal source of income, for many years. He grows corn, beans, and sorghum, and uses what he earns from his harvests to cover household expenses. He wants to buy the necessary supplies for his crops such as manure, fertilizers, seeds, and to improve his land where he sows (which can be seen in the photograph), but as he does not have the financial resources to make these improvements, he has decided to apply for a loan, since only in this way will he be able to carry on growing his crops. Like any farmer, he puts all his faith in agriculture because he does not have any other source of income and he wants to improve his life by doing the best that he can with his crops. He hopes to obtain an abundant harvest that will enable him to keep taking home the daily bread and to be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, seeds, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Mujeres De Chitocche Group

texts.es:
La señora Cipriana es madres soltera, edad 35 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos va a la escuela, borda guipiles y luego los vende, inició este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y darles todo lo que pueda, hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de telas e hilo para poder bordar las blusas; en el futuro desea que su capital sea mucho más amplio para poder producir más y asi mejorar sus ingresos, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y actividades pecuarias.
texts.en:
Cipriana is a single parent and is 35 years old. She never had the chance to go to school. She has 3 children and one of them goes to school. She embroiders guipiles [traditional indigenous blouses] and then sells them. She started this business because she needed to support her children and give them everything she could. To date she has 10 years of experience. 

She has decided to organize a group in order to apply for a loan which would enable her to buy cloth and thread so she can embroider the blouses. In the future she would like her capital to be much greater so she can produce more and so improve her income. 

The other members of the group work in business and have livestock.

loans.use: to buy cloth to embroider.

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Sreypov is aged 27 years and married with two children. Residing in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangke district, she and her husband have been farming rice for eight years to make a living. They supplement the income by catching fish in the local area. The current business earns her about KHR 13,000 per day and she can save about KHR 3,000 each day for future needs.

Sreypov has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fishing materials for her business. She hopes to catch more fish and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Aged 26 years old, Sopheak is a married mother of two children living in a rural village of Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Both children are too young for school. To support her family, Sopheak has been farming rice for four years in the village.
 
Sopheak has been with VisionFund for six cycles already and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s financial burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.She hopes this loan will help her to have more farmland to grow her rice on to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Roern's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the district of Battambang province, Roern is 47 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she has been working as a rice farmer on three hectares of farmland. Together, they can earn about 62,000 KHR per day and save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is group loan for Roern with VisionFund and they have been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and increase the family’s income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Monor's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Monor is 45 and married with three children. For the last 20 years, she has been farming rice as the primary business for her family. The current business earns her about KHR 36,000 per day to make a living and she can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

This is the sixth loan for Monor with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Monor is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Soerng's Group

texts.en:
Soerng, 60, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To better support her family, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland.  

This is the second microloan for Soerng with VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. 

Now Soerng is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Ret is 52 years old, married, and a mother of five children. She lives in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, Cambodia. To support her family, Ret has been working as a paid construction worker in the local area for four years. From the current business, she can earn about 33,000 KHR per day, and she can save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the group loan for Ret’s group of three with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now Ret and her group members are applying for a loan, which for Ret will be her fifth loan from VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her loan portion to buy materials for supporting her house. She hopes to grow her business in the future, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy materials for supporting her house

loans.name: Peka

texts.en:
Peka is a 23-year-old married woman with three children. She joined SPBD in 2013.

Peka is requesting a loan to buy chemicals, weed killer, bush-knives, and barbed wire to start a farming business. She would like to start growing taro, banana, and other crops to earn an income. Peka will use the profit from her loan to provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed killer, bush-knives, and barbed wire

loans.name: Saomalie

texts.en:
Saomalie is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. For many years, she has been growing taro, banana, and other crops on a small plantation to earn a living. Saomalie has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

Saomalie is requesting a loan to buy chemicals, a black-bag sprayer, and barbed wire for her farm. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to provide for her family’s everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a black-bag sprayer, and barbed wire

loans.name: Choey

texts.en:
Choey lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children. Choey has been in farming rice. The current business earns her about 29,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
Choey is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her rice farming. She hopes this loan will enable her to produce more crops, so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farming.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot lives in the village David-Bek, in the Syunik region. He is married and has two school-aged sons; they are twins. His wife doesn't work, and she helps Ashot very much around their farm.

Ashot, himself, has been engaged in agriculture and farming for thirty years. In his farm he has cattle, pigs, bees, and agricultural machinery, including a tractor. Ashot is a very kind and hardworking man, and he helps his neighbors and fellow villagers in agricultural work, with his tractor. He also sells his agricultural products in the wholesale markets of Kapan, or sometimes to re-sellers. The profit from agriculture allows Ashot to support his family, as well as possible.

Ashot asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) from Kiva. He will use the loan to buy some tractor spare parts, which will enable him to work faster and more productively.

loans.use: To buy parts for his tractor

loans.name: Tavhida

texts.ru: Тавхиде 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании 3 детей. Тавхида является основной кормилицей своих 3 детей, так как ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Тавхида имеет высшее экономическое образование. Она имеет более чем 20 лет стаж работы. Она более чем одного года работает в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ бухгалтером. Она является одной из лучших работников организации. Тавхида старается, чтобы ее дети были образованными и интеллигентными людьми. Ее старшая дочь студентка 3 курса факультета Иностранных языков. Вторая дочь студентка 1 курса юридического факультета. Тавхида тратит свои деньги для образования своих детей. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома, а также покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tavhida is 45 years old and she is married with three children.  She is the main breadwinner for her three children, as her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.  Tavhida has a higher education in economics and she has more than 20 years of work experience.  For more than a year, she has been working as a bookkeeper at IMON International.  She is one of the best workers in the organization.  Tavhida works hard so her children will be educated and intelligent people.  Her eldest daughter is a third-year student in the department of foreign languages and her other daughter is a first-year law student.  Tavhida spends her money on the education of her children.  For a few years, she has planned to make repairs to their home, as it is in a poor condition.  She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy building materials to repair her home, and also to purchase furniture.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house and to buy furniture

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en:
Loimata is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. For many years, she has been growing bananas, yams, taro, and other crops to earn a living. Loimata has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

Loimata is requesting a loan to buy chemicals for her farm along with nails, iron roofing materials, and cement to improve her home. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to help with her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for her farm and nails, iron roofing materials, and cement to improve her home

loans.name: Leuluasi

texts.en:
Leuluasi is 55 years old and married with four children. For many years, she has owned and operated a small store where she sells items such as sugar, flour, laundry soap, raw meat, and other products. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

Leuluasi is requesting a loan to buy a sack of sugar, a bag of rice, a box of chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, cartons of milk, and Vailima beers. She hopes to use the profit from her loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, cartons of milk, and Vailima beers

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en: Theophile is 24 years old. He is single and has been in business for the past six years. Theophile, would like to sell spare parts of motorcycles in conjunction with his already existing business of motorbike transportation.He has requested this loan to buy more spare parts for the motorbike for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri and his small family live in Vnadzor city. Valeri has no higher education, and it is already ten years that he has his own modest business. He works in a small garage adjacent to the building that he lives, where he repairs engines and paints cars which are mainly produced in the Soviet Union. He also makes car plate smoothing. Valeri has many loyal customers who trust their cars only to him. 

His work is hard and requires more time but Valeri never complains. He is always ready to help and give some advice to anyone who has some problems with his car. The income from his business barely covers his family’s needs, but he is sure that his business will go ahead, if he can manage to buy some new tools that he needs for car repairing. Valeri asks for a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams to buy a welding machine. 

He is sure that his deal with Kiva lenders will be good for his future.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine

loans.name: Lady

texts.es: Lady, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer amable y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Luís, quien trabaja en una empresa como conductor de tractores. Tiene 3 hijos de 21, 14, y 04 años de edad respectivamente. El trabajo de Lady consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas como gaseosas de diferentes sabores y cervezas de marcas distintas y golosinas tales como galletas , caramelos , chicles , entre otros.  Cuenta con una refrigeradora para mantener heladas sus bebidas. Su actividad lo realiza en un local en el interior de su vivienda propia , lleva 03 años en esta actividad económica. Se inició en esta actividad par ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. En el futuro piensa alquilar un local comercial en una buena ubicación para vender golosinas al por mayor.Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 04  con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo.Con el monto solicitado deS/.1000 soles comprará bebidas gasificadas como cervezas de diferentes marcas y gaseosas de distintos sabores , también comprará golosinas  como galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.
texts.en:
Lady is a friendly and happy 36-year-old woman. She lives in a house she owns with her husband Luís, who works at a company as a tractor driver. She has three children aged 21, 14, and 4 years respectively. Lady's work consists of selling carbonated beverages like soft drinks of different flavors, beers of various brands, and sweets like cookies, caramels and gum, among other things. She has a refrigerator to keep her drinks cold. She has had this business in a space inside her home for 3 years. She started this business to help her husband with their living expenses.

In the future she thinks she will rent a commercial space in a good location to sell sweets wholesale. This will be her 4th loan with Kiva and she feels very grateful for the financial support that she receives to continue with her work. With the requested amount of 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, she will buy carbonated beverages like beers of different brands and soft drinks of various flavors. She will also buy sweets like cookies, chocolates, caramels, etc.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages and sweets

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is aged 34 years. She lives with her family in a rural village, in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has four children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for ten years. The current business earns her family about 31,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the third loan for Nat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. Nat wants to use her portion of this new loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to use on her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and fruitfully, so as to sell it for a good price and improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland

loans.name: Seu

texts.en: Seu is 43 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a small business selling biscuits, donuts, cooked noddles, etc. in her community and has been doing this for many years. Seu has requested a loan to buy a bag of rice, onions, curry, noodles and foil for her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seu will try to expand her business to all schools in her district.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice, onions, curry, noodles and foil

loans.name: Sergelenbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Sergelenbaatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as an electrician since 1980 and accumulated a vast amount of experience. His wife has the position of supervisor at a private business entity, and before this job she used to run a hock shop. 

The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. So Sergelenbaatar is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he can repair and insulate his old house. As a result, the family will reduce its coal consumption, thus releasing fewer pollutants which will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Saeuomalo

texts.en:
Saeuomalo is 21 years old and married with no children. For the past two years, she has run a small business selling fish in her community. Saeuomalo joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital.

Saeuomalo is requesting a loan to buy fishing lures and a rod, net, and spears. With the earnings from her loan, she will help provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing lures and a rod, net, and spears

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan, of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, is a married man with two children. 

For a living, he owns and manages his piggery, raising piglets for sale. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and he gains access to microfinance services from the Cooperative.

Recently, Jonathan requested a loan in the amount of PHP 2,500 to purchase feed. He plans to renovate his livestock's shelter, to be used for piggery expansion.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
Mr. Battumur, 59 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been working as an engineer at a power station since 2011, and before this job he worked at various places and accumulated a vast amount of experience in engineering. 

His wife is disabled and gets a state pension. As he and his wife get older, they need an automobile to drive to their workplace and home. So, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which has an electric engine. 

Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution through the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. Considering the advantages of electric cars, it is the best option to purchase this car which will contribute to the family's work and health as well as to the environment. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 41-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro crops and bananas. She also has a pancake business to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

She has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a back bag sprayer, a sack of flour, dripping oil, a bag of  sugar and baking powder.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Susana hopes to help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a back bag sprayer, a sack of flour, dripping oil, a bag of  sugar and baking powder.

loans.name: Agustin Antonio

texts.es: Don Agustín, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace varios años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla a los mercados de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtienen de las ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don  Agustín esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como:Herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y poderle dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Agustin lives in his own house with his wife and four children. He has been growing corn and beans for several years. When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos that can be seen in the picture, so that later he can sell it at the markets where people buy and sell basic grains. He uses the profits that he makes from the sales to cover some of the household expenses. Agustin is requesting a loan to be able to buy the necessary supplies such as herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc. to continue growing his crops and to be able to give his family everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah and Manuel are deaf and have been in business for five years, using the sign language symbol for “I love you” as their signature on every wooden craft they complete.

Returning clients of Accion Texas Inc., the husband and wife create crafts from wood and run the San Antonio business S & M Crafts along with one full-time employee--creating items such as welcome signs, wind chimes, baskets, frames and other wooden home décor.  Whether you are looking for something for yourself or a gift, you can find it here.

To earn profits, the couple attends craft shows where they present and sell their designs. To increase the number of craft shows they attend, they needed a loan.  This is when they returned to Accion. Once they had applied and were approved, Sarah and Manuel increased their sales and secured spots at craft shows around the state.

loans.use: to increase their sales and secure spots at craft shows .

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 50 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a driver. Jacqueline supports him by raising pigs to sell in the the community of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Jacqueline is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase piglets to raise and sell. In the future, she plans to expand her business to gain more income and provide better living conditions for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: Cornelia is from Rizal, Ozamis City. She is a 53-year-old married mom with four children. To make a living, Cornelia plants, harvests and sells vegetables. Aside from her garden, she also operates a business weaving nipa for sale. Cornelia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for weaving. Cornelia has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to be used for weaving.

loans.name: Tunas Rahayu Group

texts.en: The Tunas Rahayu group is continuing its loan. Ni Putu is using her portion of the loan to buy two superior-quality piglets and feed. With the increase in prices for pigs, she expects a satisfactory profit. Ni Putu is very grateful because this business has proven to help her family's income. Her children can go to school and she can meet their everyday needs. She has a plan to build a nicer house.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal, 40 years old, lives with his mother in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a two-room apartment. He has been working as a foreign relations manager at a private business entity since 2010. Before this job, he had been working for fourteen years in the USA on an employment contract. His mother has retired from work and now gets a state pension. 

During the winter time, the apartment they live in loses its heat through walls and windows, and they use lots of hot water to heat their home. So Batjargal is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase vacuum insulated windows, fiberglass and hardwood floors. 

After installing the vacuum windows and hardwood floors and insulating the walls with fiberglass, the apartment will no longer lose its heat and will preserve energy and provide comfortable and warm accommodations for its owners. Batjargal is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum insulated windows, hardwood floors and fiberglass.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin of Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, provides for his family through his construction supplies business. He is 52 years old, married, and tries his best to earn. Aside from doing this business, he also has a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale and for family consumption. He joined GDMPC micro finance in 2011 and thanks them for the trust they provide to him. 

Recently, Benjamin borrowed an amount of 9,000 PHP to finance the labor costs for weeding, maintenance and land preparation. He desires to improve his business and to multiply his income in the future.

loans.use: to finance the labor costs for weeding, maintenance, and land preparation.

loans.name: Faatuatua

texts.en:
Faatuatua is a 26-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Faatuatua has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, bush knives and crops. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2013. With her profits, Faatuatua hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, fertilizer and crops.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is from San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 60 years old. Ricardo is married and has five children. He has a farm where he grows a variety of plants. To purchase fertilizer, such as manure, he borrowed an amount of 35,000 from GDMPC micro-credit (which he joined in 2010). Ricardo hopes to invest more in this business in order to generate more income for better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Pelemoni

texts.en: Pelemoni is 35 years old and married with four children. For three years she has run a small business selling fish in her community. Pelemoni has requested a loan to buy lures, fishing nets, goggles, a spear and a canoe. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. Pelemoni will use her earnings to help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy lures, fishing nets, goggles, a spear and a canoe.

loans.name: Fuataga

texts.en: Fuataga is 45 years old and married with four children. For many years she has run a small business selling fish in her community. Fuataga has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, spears, a fishing rod and fishing torch. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuataga will buy a modern fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, spears, a fishing rod and fishing torch.

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en: Simplicio is 60 years old and married with three children. He lives in Kahayagan East, Aurora. For the past years, Simplicio has operated a food vending business. He uses his motorcycle to deliver his food and earns a monthly income of 15,000 PHP. Aside from vending, he also offers motor transportation services in his community to earn additional income for his family. Recently he requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to repair his motor. He plans to use the profit from his loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle's motor.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a permanent resident of Nyakayojo, a village in Mbarara district, and is 47 years old. He is married and has 8 children and 3 dependents from his aunt who died 5 years ago. Due to the fact that all his children and dependents are in school, he was forced by circumstances to do the business of piggery and pig butchery in order to earn a living for his family and dependents. This business has grown, enabling him to support his family and even pay school fees for his children. He has a small semi-permanent house for his family but the house is old to the extent that it leaks during rainy season. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) to renovate his house and the balance will be used to clear tuition for the children and dependents.In the photograph is Abel with his wife who also signed the kiva waiver.

loans.use: To buy materials and hire labour for renovating his residential house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and has three children. She lives in Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing. Each month Victoria earns 4,200 PHP. She joined GDMPC in 2011. 

She is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan for additional working capital for purchase inventory. In the future, she hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to have additional working capital for inventory.

loans.name: Valasi

texts.en: Valasi is 21 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years. Valasi has requested a loan to buy fishing nets, spears, goggles, a cooler and a new canoe. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Valasi will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, spears, goggles,a cooler and a new canoe.

loans.name: Abundio

texts.en: Abundio of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental is a 23-year-old single man providing motor transport services in his community. He's been doing this business for two years. In 2012, he joined GDMPC micro credit, gaining access to its micro finance services. Recently, he borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires and to renew his license. He plans to save his revenue from this business for maintenance and to provide his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of tires and to renew his license.

loans.name: Ella Cecilia

texts.en:
Ella Cecilia is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. To help her husband, she manages her own retail store, selling dry goods in the market. She's been doing this for a year and is earning an amount of about 3,000 PHP a month. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to use as capital to purchase additional inventory for her store. She hopes and plans to expand her business to create better living conditions for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is 43 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling convenience foods in her community and has been doing this for three years. Koreti has requested a loan to buy flour, a box of chicken, sausages, soy sauce, curry powder and potatoes. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Koreti will improve the standard of her business to earn a good income.

loans.use: to buy flour, a box of chicken, sausages, soy sauce, curry powder and potatoes.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is from Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 27 years old. Mylene is married and has three children. To make a living, Mylene manages a business venture, providing transportation services. Aside from these services, she also manages her own retail store selling groceries in her community. 

In 2011, Mylene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, spices and bottled products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, sugar, spices and bottled products for sale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is a 34-year-old married woman with four children who lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has a store where she sells goods in the local community. She has been in this business for four years. In 2007, she joined GDMPC to gain access to micro-finance services and is now requesting 7,000 PHP. She plans to use the loan to purchase bottled products, milk saches, shampoo, biscuits and sugar to sell. She hopes to increase her income and double her capital from her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase bottled products, milk saches, shampoo, biscuits and sugar.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe
