Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Wilder trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja realizando labores de sembrado, fumigación, cosecha y otros, Wilder trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Wilder se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente tiene una cocina a leña, cuyo uso es peligroso, de esta manera Wilder y su familia podrán preparar adecuadamente sus alimentos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Wilber is a 22 year old man.  He is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic worker with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately he was unable to study for a career as a mechanic, due to a lack of resources and because he needed to help his parents.  He likes to do crossword puzzles in his spare time and on occasion likes to cook delicious pallares to share with his family.

Through his own effort and dedication, Wilber works as a field worker on a farm in his town.  He plants, fumigates, harvests, and other things.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes that things are going well for him because of his good work and friendly service to others.

Wilber is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy a stove because he currently uses firewood, which is dangerous.  In this way Wilber and his family will be able to cook his food adequately.  He will continue to work hard and make an effort to achieve his greatest dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo is a person who always tries to find a source of income. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a master of house repair. Zebo always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry when her children were little. She manages the business alone. Her son does not have a higher education to find work in Tajikistan and to get a good salary. That’s why her son wants to go to Russia to find a job. Zebo requested a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy an air ticket for her son. She awaits your support and promises to make payments on time.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her son

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 28 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en una colonia del sector de La Lopez Arellano, municipio de Choloma. Ella tiene 5 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de confección de ropa intima para damas. Ella adquirió experiencia cuando trabajo en una maquila. Su mercado es local en la zona donde vive. actualmente esta solicitando un tercer préstamo a ODEF por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar la materia prima como telas, hilos y otros para poder confeccionar ropa interior para damas y poder cubrir los pedidos pendientes de sus clientes. Su plan es poder comprar un terreno donde ubicar el taller separado del hogar.
texts.en: Rosa is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the La Lopez Arellano neighborhood of the city of Choloma.  She has had her own intimate apparel making business for five years and gained experience while she worked in a factory.  Her customers are local to her zone.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras, her third loan through ODEF, so she can buy supplies such as fabric, thread, and other things so she can make undergarments to cover customer orders.  Her plan is to buy some land to set up her workshop separate from her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a 43-year-old divorced shopkeeper. She is blessed with two children. Naomi has been running her general shop for the past four years with a monthly income of 7,100 KES, which she uses to provide for her children.

Naomi is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy sugar, oil, and bundles of flour to resell.  With the expected profits, she will reinvest in her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to start a wholesale shop in her home town.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, and bundles of flour for sale.

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan is a 32-year-old man. He is married and has two little daughters. Bogdan works in a finance company. He is honest, reliable, and he loves God and his family.

Now Bogdan is living in his wife parents' house. At the same time, they are building a new house. It is almost done. It will be great holiday when Bogdan and his family move into their new residence. 

Bogdan is asking for a loan of 15,000 UAH. He wants to complete repairs in the kitchen and finally move into his new house with his family.

loans.use: to finish construction of his house and move in with his family.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 23-year-old business lady, who is married to Emmanuel, a business man. They are blessed with one child who is six years old. Jackline has been selling green groceries for the past three years, and she makes a monthly income of 9,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Jackline is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD . She will use the loan to buy sacks of kale, cabbage, carrots and tomatoes. She will reinvest her expected profits in her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to settle all her debts and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of kale, cabbage, carrots and tomatoes.

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "God is Able" group. She has been a client of ID-Ghana for three years and has taken out four previous loans. She is a tenacious mother who works intensely for the well-being of her two children. She is the motor that drives this tireless group, who sells fish, foodstuff, stationery, biscuits, as well as toffee. 

The new injection of business capital will help buy two cartons of tuna fish, since her clients have increased considerably. With the previous loans she was able to improve her family's living conditions and meet one of her short term goals: to pay her children's school fees in full. 

Together with Victoria are two other members of the group, all very dedicated, with wishes to get ahead. They need a total amount of 1,800 GHS to realize improvement in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of tuna fish, since her clients have increased considerably.

loans.name: Ashraq Group

texts.en: This group is called Ashraq. It consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Collectively, they took out a loan of 120,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). Wahba is the leader of this group. She is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She is an uneducated woman who wishes to raise her children up well. She has a small amount to buy home furnishings, but it is not enough. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 41-year-old housewife with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a welder. Azra has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is taking out this loan for her husband to buy welding materials such as iron rods, welding rods, soldering rod, and iron sheets. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She will use the profit for household expenses. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Esther is in her late 40s and is married with four children, only one of whom is still going to school.  She has been running a beauty salon for 10 years now.  She works from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Esther's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more salon equipment. She dreams of opening a wholesale shop for selling salon equipment.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, "Mnuka," which has twelve members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment.

loans.name: Yudel Ondina

texts.es: Doña Yudel, habitante del barrio Memorial Sandino, es una humilde trabajadora domestica desde hace varios años, con su esposo busca como mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, más ahora que las lluvias se meten al interior de su casa. El crédito lo solicita para comprar materiales de construcción y continuar una parte de la pared de concreto que aún le falta, la cual viene haciendo poco a poco por sus pocas posibilidades económicas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es albañil y se encarga de la mano de obra, esta mejora le vendrá bien para mantener en mejores condiciones su hogar y sus hijos vivan en un ambiente sano y limpio.
texts.en: Doña Yudel, a resident of the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, has been a humble domestic worker for a number of years.  With her husband, she seeks to improve the conditions of their residence, especially now that the rains are entering into the interior of their house. She is applying for the loan to buy construction materials and continue part of the concrete wall that is still missing, which they have been making little by little because of their limited economic possibilities. She has the help of her husband, who is a bricklayer and will take care of the labor. This improvement will help her keep her home in better conditions and help their children to live in a healthy and clean environment.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron

loans.name: Realey

texts.en:
Realey is a 65-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is a widow and has 7 children between the ages of 40 and 28.  She describes herself as hard working. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

Realey has a warehouse which has sold charcoal by the bag for the past twenty years.  She works 8 hours at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is the rainy season. She intends to use the loan to buy more charcoal. She started her business with money from her children.  She likes her business because it keeps her busy.  She hopes to one day buy a car.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Ronnel

texts.en: Ronnel of Aurora Zamboanga del Sur is married and has four children. To make a living, he has provided transportation services in his local community for years. He joined GDMPC to gain access to microfinance and recently, he has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase a new set of tires. He plans to have another motorcycle unit to extend the services that he provides. He also hopes to see his children successful in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new set of tires.

loans.name: Noupagagnon 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe   NOUPAGAGNON 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mamoutou debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 500.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the NOUPAGAGNON 2 group are married men who, on average, are 41 years old and have five children each. They all live in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages of the Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Mamoutou, grows maize. In the photo, he is second from the left in the standing row. He plans to use his loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 3 hectares (7.41 acres) of land.

After the harvest, he sells his crop in the village and at the Sikasso market. His customers are both men and women.

Mamoutou is expecting to make an average profit of 500,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow him to repay his loan and to contribute to his large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish paying for his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter's university expenses

loans.name: Jiguiseme I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  JIGUISEME I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Kafana, un des villages de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec ADJA                                              debout au milieu. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the JIGUISEME I group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kafana, one of the villages of the Cercle of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Adja, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, in order to cultivate 1 hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in the village and at the Sikasso market. Her customers are both men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 125,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Rana is a 22-year-old married woman from the city of Qalqilia. She is a mother with one daughter. Her husband is a worker with a low wage, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs. 

Rana and her husband would like to complete their new home and live in better conditions, so they took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help to pay all the necessary costs for completing their new home.

loans.use: to cover the costs of completing a new home.

loans.name: Jiguiseme Ii Group

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution so they can carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and past loans have been fully repaid.

Waraba, who is standing in the middle, cultivates peanuts. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain 2.5 acres.

After harvest production is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to achieve an average profit of 80,000 FCFA per growing season.

Profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs and seeds

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKELEMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Monpiela, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec Kadia debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.

The members of the BENKELEMA 3 group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Monpiela, one of the villages of the commune of Niena, in the Sikasso region (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans. 

The featured borrower, Kadia, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, in order to cultivate 1.5 hectare (3.7 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both men and women, in her village and at the Sikasso market.

Kadia is expecting to make an average profit of 150,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Yousif

texts.en:
Yousif is a 24-year-old single man. He lives in a small house with his family in Jenin. Yousuf's family owns a small olive tree farm. It is a profitable business but not enough to cover all the family expenses and needs. 
Yousif took a $1,700 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to cover his wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay his wedding expenses

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 62-year-old married man from Jenin city. He is the father of two sons and seven daughters. He used to be a worker in the public sector but is retired now and works in a small shop in the popular market. He sells cosmetics and hand bags for women. 
Mahmoud took a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more stock for his store and will increase Mahmoud's income. 
Mahmoud appears in the photo while he was working in his store.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of two sons and one daughter. Salah works as an engineer in the public sector and gets a good income. 
Salah requested a USD $650 loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop. This laptop will be very useful to prepare some reports for his job. 
Salah appears in a Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business

loans.name: Bassma

texts.en:
Bassma is a married women, 27 years old a mother of four children. Bassma is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online,so her husband appears for her in this Kiva profile photo.
Bassma is living in a humble house in Gaza city with a decent income but not enough to cover all expenses needed by the family. Bassma is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing a new mobile phone.

loans.use: to buy a new mobile phone

loans.name: Al-Baraa'

texts.en: Al-baraa’ is a Palestinian single young man, 19 years old. His father is employed and earns a small salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs. Al-baraa’ is a university student, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Al-baraa’ to do his homework and reports and help him in his studies. This will ensure a better future for Al-baraa’ and improve his living conditions. Al-baraa’ is photographed at the university where he studies.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Insherah

texts.en:
Insherah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Insherah is a married woman of 61 years. She is a mother for 2 sons and 1 daughter. Insherah's husband works at a company receiving a low salary that doesn’t cover the expenses of the family. Insherah is requesting a $2000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing electrical equipment such as a refrigerator, television and washing machine that will help her to provide comfortable living conditions and make her life easier.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, television and washing machine for her home

loans.name: Kenneth Eduardo

texts.es:
Kenneth, es un joven que desde muy pequeño soñó un día tener su propio negocio . Tiene un año de dedicarse a la venta de repuestos para motos y carro. Él está muy agradecido por la confianza y oportunidad que le dieron por medio de su primer crédito y crear un buen record crediticio, el cual utilizo para comprar repuestos. Actualmente ofrecer mejores productos y se cambió a un local más amplio. 
Su meta a futuro es tener un negocio exitoso, su meta próxima es comprar repuestos de motos como cascos, motores, bovina, buchings, cadenas, foco y accesorios para carros, que es para lo cual está solicitando el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Kenneth is a young man who has dreamed of having his own business ever since he was little.  For a year now he has been selling motorcycle and auto spare parts.  He is very grateful for the confidence shown in him and the opportunity he received through his first loan, allowing him to establish a good credit record.  He used the loan to buy parts and now offers better products after moving into a larger shop.

His goal for the future is to have a successful business.  The new loan he is requesting is to buy motorcycle and auto parts and accessories such as helmets, engines, coils, bushings, chains, and lamps.

loans.use: To buy helmets, engines, coils, bushings, chains, lamps and auto accessories.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old, married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Lilibeth has run a general store for years and earns 3,600 PHP each month from these activities. Lilibeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional working inventory. In 2010, Lilibeth joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase items for her general store

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is a married mother with three dependents. She lives in Upper Bayao, Tukuran. She owns and operates a general store, generating an income of 3,600 PHP per month. She has been in business for three years. Juvy requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. In the future, she wants to purchase pedicabs for her other business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Enkhtsetseg is 45 years old and lives with her sister and brother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. She has been working as a doctor (a very low paid position in Mongolia) at a hospital for seven years and accumulated vast amounts of experience in the medical field. Her sister runs a pawnshop. The house they live in has deteriorating ceilings and walls which is very difficult in the extremely cold Winters with heat loss and fuel costs. So she is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as planks, cement, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, she will repair and insulate her house. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke and contribute to the efforts against reducing air pollution. She is very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase planks, cement, fiberglass and foam

loans.name: Nida Group

texts.en:
Nida is a group composed of five Filipino ladies wishing to acquire a loan from Al Majmoua. They all work as housekeepers for Lebanese families and decided to join hands and establish the group because they all truly need support with their financial expenses. Nida is the group leader, and featured member of the group. She is the lady sitting in the center of the picture. She is a 44 year-old single mother. She has five children that are all under 18, and they live with her retired parents back in the Philippines. She is the only financial provider of the family since the childrens' father does not acknowledge the family anymore. The fact that she has a very low income makes it impossible for her to be able to rightfully provide for her children, or even cover her own expenses. The Al Majmoua loan would at least allow her to cover the schooling tuition fees of her five children.
Deveniel is a 31 year-old single mother as well. She is the woman sitting second to the left of the picture. She has a son who lives with her parents back in Philippine. She needs the Al Majmoua loan in order to send the money to her son to cover some of his expenses.
Akiniha is a 53 year-old single lady, sitting second to the right of the picture. She joined the Nidad group because she needs the Al Majmoua loan to transfer it to her family back in the Philippines for an emergency.
Evelyn is 46 year-old single lady as well, sitting in the far left of the picture. She wishes to acquire the Al Majmoua loan in order to help her family and her retired parents back in the Philippines.
Sara Jane is a 24 year-old young single lady, sitting on the far right of the picture. She needs the Al Majmoua loan to send the money to her family in the Philippines.

loans.use: to cover the schooling tuition fees of her five children.

loans.name: Mouskeba Nene's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 05 Décembre  2000 à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il compte 26 femmes très dynamiques, elles  vivent dans le même village et sont dans le programme des bancs villageois depuis plus une décennie. Elles ont  comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Néné (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main  levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Très active au sein du banc villageois. Elle est âgée de 44  ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 03 garçons et 03 filles. Elle est vend de l’encense plus connu sous le nom de « THIOURAYE ». Pour ce faire elle achète les grains auprès des femmes en provenance de la sous région, procède au mélange par l’addiction de parfum et autres ingrédients. Le produit fini est conditionné dans de petits seaux. Qu’elle vend à crédit par deux échéances.

 Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter les grains bruts pour 35 000 FCFA et les parfums et autres ingrédients à 15000 F Cfa et les petits seaux pour 5 000F Cfa à raison de 300 F Cfa en moyenne le seau. 

Les bénéfices réalises lui permettent d’augmenter son épargne dans le but de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
The group was created December 5, 2000 at the opening of their "Banc Villageois" loan association. It consists of 26 very active women who live in the same village and have been in the "Banc Villageois" program for over a decade. Their main activity is small retail commerce.

Mrs. Nene (standing on the far right with a raised hand) is the group's featured borrower. Very active in the "Banc Villageois", she is 44 years old, married and mother of six children including three boys and three girls.

She sells incense better known as "thiouraye". To do this she buys incense grains from women in the sub-region, and then prepares a mix by adding perfume and other ingredients. The finished product is packaged in small buckets she sells on credit in two installments.

With the new loan, she will buy raw incense grains for 35,000 FCFA, fragrances and other ingredients for 15,000 FCFA, and small buckets for 5,000 FCFA, at 300 FCFA on average per bucket.

The profits garnered will enable her to increase her savings to better support her family.

loans.use: buy raw incense grains for 35,000 FCFA, fragrances and other ingredients for 15,000 FCFA, and 5,000 FCFA's worth of small buckets for 300 FCFA a bucket on average

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
El señor Teófilo  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en un centro de compra de Managua  desde hace 12 años donde empieza a laborar desde la 6 am y termina hasta 5 de la tarde en el área de seguridad.

Don Teófilo solicita a kiva  un crédito para la construcción de un muro en la parte delantera de su vivienda ya que  es necesario para la seguridad de su  hogar.

A la vez manifiesta su agradecimiento  ya que con los créditos obtenidos anteriormente con nuestra institución ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida para darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Teófilo lives in the city of Managua and has been working there at a shopping center, in the security area,  for 12 years.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Teófilo is requesting a loan to build a wall along the front of his house to provide more safety for his family.  

He wants to express his gratitude for the previous loans he has had through the institution which have improved his living conditions and made his family more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo Adolfo vive en  la cuidad de Managua de trabaja desde hace 20 años en una universidad de Managua como guarda de seguridad.

Gustavo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zinc y perline para hacer el cambio de techo a su vivienda que con la venida del invierno  es necesario.

Y agradece a kiva por la oportunidad que se le está dado para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gustavo Adolfo lives in the city of Managua where he has worked as a security guard at the university for 20 years.

He is requesting a loan to buy metal sheeting and beams to change the roof of his house since the onset of winter makes it it necessary.

Gustavo is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity to make this home improvement.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting.

loans.name: Carlos Fidel

texts.es:
El joven Carlos Fidel vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en  el área de limpieza en un centro de compra de la capital.

Es un joven con muchos deseo de salir adelante ya que trabaja y  está estudiando vive en la casa de sus padres  
Carlos solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de un cuarto de habitación  y necesita comprar materiales  de construcción como cemento, bloque, y pago de mano de obra.

 Según el esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus padre y la del el mismo agradeciendo mucho a kiva por  este beneficio para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Fidel lives in the city of Managua where he works at a shopping center in the cleaning department.

This young man is very determined to get ahead because he both works and studies.  He lives with his parents and is requesting a loan to build another room.  He must buy construction materials such as cement and blocks and hire workers.

He claims he wants to improve his parents' living conditions and also wants to thank Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as blocks, sand, iron and cement.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo “NUEVO HORIZONTE” está conformado 10 personas que tienen algo en común son muy trabajadores y emprendedores dedicadas a diversas actividades  para sacar adelante a sus familias.
 Una de estas personas es Carmen que tiene 59 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, pero que aún los ayuda en su educación.
Ella desde que tuvo 20 años se independizó y empezó con el negocio de venta de ropa, en este negocio la ayudan sus dos hijos, ya que ella es el único sustento de su familia.

A Carmen le gusta mucha realizar su trabajo por que así ha conocido mucha gente.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales y tener un "BAZAR - LICORERIA"
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería de temporada (chompas, casacas, pantalones, etc.) 
Ella y todo su grupo están satisfechos por el apoyo recibido y agradecen a los inversionistas KIVA "por tener un buen corazón  de ayudar a los demás". Carmen viste un conjunto deportivo color rosado con negro, en la parte media superior, está la fotografía de Marco Julián.
texts.en:
The communal bank "NUEVO HORIZONTE" is comprised of ten members who are hard-working entrepreneurs dedicated to different businesses in order to provide for their families.

One of the members is Carmen, 59, who is a single mother of two adult children who she continues supporting in their studies.  When she was 20 years old she became independent and established a business selling clothing.  Her two children help with the business since she is the only bread-winner for the family.

Carmen enjoys her job because it has allowed her to meet many people.  Her goal is to see her children become professionals and for her to have her own "BAZAAR - LIQUOR STORE" one day.

The loan she is requesting is to buy seasonal clothing (sweaters, jackets, pants, etc.).  She and the other members of the group are pleased with the support they are receiving and grateful to KIVA lenders "for having a good heart and helping others".  In the photograph, Carmen is the one wearing a black and pink track suit.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing (sweaters, polo shirts, jackets)

loans.name: Maximo , Jr

texts.en:
Maximo Jr is 31 years old, married and has two children. They live in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur and he owns and operates a service based business, providing electronic repairs in the community.

He has been in this business for 11 years and he earns an income to support the basic needs of the family. Recently, he became a new member of GDMPC and requested an amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional tools and accessories to improve the services he has been providing. 

He hopes to see his business grow in order to have a better standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and accessories

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in Mombasa Kenya. 

She operates a taxi business and has one employee. She heard about Milango through one of her relatives. She is now seeking a loan of 41,900 Kenyan Shillings to buy spare parts and repair her vehicle. 

In five years, she wants to buy more cars and increase her customer base. She is a single mother of one.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair her vehicle

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 52 year-old man living in a Lebanese village with his wife. 

Everyday, he drives back and forth from one village to the other in his van, transporting people on his way; this is how he earns his everyday income. His wife is unemployed, which makes him the family's only provider. 

His revenue barely covers their monthly expenses. He contacted Al Majmoua because it was his last hope to be able to renovate some parts of his home that had become completely unusable. In fact, he needs a loan in order to change the floor of both his kitchen and balcony. 

Mahmoud's ambition for the future is to open up his own car washing station in his village, which would require an even bigger loan.

loans.use: to change the floor of both his kitchen and balcony

loans.name: Wendzoodo Nooma Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA représente le groupe  WENDZOODO NOOMA. Elle se porte bien ainsi que toute sa famille. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 36ans et le moins âgé a 16ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme vent du beurre de karité  depuis 09ans. Son crédit s’est bien passé. Elle s’approvisionne  dans les provinces du Burkina. Ses clients sont ceux qui fabriquent le savon.
Mme veut s’acheter 150 plats de beurre de karité. 
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec  ses  économies. Son ambition est d’avoir des clients dans les pays extérieurs mais aussi s’acheter une moto et une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Lamoussa represents the Wendzoodo Nooma group. She is in good health, as well as her whole family. She is the married mother of three children, the oldest of whom is 36 years old, and the youngest 16. Two of the children go to school, and she has three persons to support.

Ms. Lamoussa has been selling shea butter for nine years. Her loan went well. She resupplies from the provinces in Burkina Faso, and her customers are those who make soap.

She wants to purchase 150 dishes of shea butter. She wants to bolster her business with her savings. Her ambition is to have customers from abroad but also to buy a motorbike and a plot of land.

loans.use: 150 dishes to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has eight children. Hadi, along with two of his children, provide the family income.

Hadi is a barber. He considers cutting hair as his hobby. He gained his experience from his father, who was also a barber. In 1988, Hadi established his own business and gained a good reputation in the neighborhood.

Hadi is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent on his barber shop. Hadi aims to increase his profits by expanding his business, so that he may provide his children with a good future.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his barber shop

loans.name: Bitari

texts.en:
Bitari is a married woman with three children. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family and fees for her children.

She sells cooked food from home to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is married and a proud mother of two. Both her children attend school. 

She has been operating a food canteen for three years now. She sells cooked food. She heard about Milango through a friend. She is seeking a loan of 21,100 Kenya Shillings to buy a bundle of wheat flour, 10 kgs of beans and 20 litres of cooking oil. 

The major challenge she faces is debts and, at times, the price of commodities is unbearable. She wants to have a restaurant in five years and employ people. 

The income from the loan will educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of wheat flour, 10 kgs of beans and 20 litres of cooking oil.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina. She previously accessed an 17,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rufina dreams that her business will continue to be successful and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Uuriintuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Uurintuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their house on a plot of land. 

She and her husband have been making and selling bread to local people since 2009 and have accumulated a vast amount of experience. The house they live in is used as a workshop for making and storing bread. 

Her business is prospering and its working capital is increasing continuously. So, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials, such as cement, bricks and planks, in order to put an extension onto her house. After doing the extension, she can store bread in large quantities and sell it to local people without worrying about an inventory shortage. 

The borrower is very a hardworking individual, who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials, such as cement, bricks and planks

loans.name: Benkelema 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKELEMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Monpiela, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec   Sitan debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 1 group are married women who are on average 37 years of age with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Monpiela, a village in the municipality of Niena in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and previous loans have been duly repaid.

Sitan, who is standing in the middle, cultivates groundnuts. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain 1.5 hectares (3.7 acres).

After harvesting, the production is sold in the village, and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   BENKELEMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Monpiela, un des villages de la commune de Niena dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec Kadiatou debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkelema 2 group are married women who are on average 37 years of age with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Monpiela, a village in the municipality of Niena in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and previous loans have been duly repaid.

Kadiatou, who is standing in the middle, cultivates groundnuts. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain 1.5 hectares (3.7 acres).

After harvesting, the production is sold in the village, and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 150,000 FCFA per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 31 year-old man living with his wife and only child. 

He earns his living by transporting people across his home town city in his taxi. His wife works as a mobile housekeeper and has a very low income, which renders their socioeconomic status very low. 

Nevertheless, they enrolled their child in a private school, in order to secure his future for him to overcome the poverty they live in. Charles contacted Al Majmoua because he wishes to acquire a small loan that would enable him to buy a new refrigerator and pay for car maintenance expenses. 

In fact, maintaining his car is highly important for him to increase his customer base and thus his revenue, which would alleviate the tuition fees' burden.  

As for the future, Charles wishes to purchase his own license plate.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and pay for car maintenance expenses

loans.name: Kato Allama 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    KATO ALLAMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bougoulaba, un des villages de la commune de Wateni dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Alima debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kato Allama 1 group are married women who are on average 38 years of age with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, a village in the municipality of Wateni in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and previous loans have been duly repaid.

Alima, who is standing in the middle, grows corn. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain 1 hectare (2.47 acres).

After harvesting, the production is sold in the village, and at the Sikasso market to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 95,000 FCFA per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Kato Allama 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    KATO ALLAMA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bougoulaba, un des villages de la commune de Wateni dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le maïs avec  Korotoumou  debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kato Allama 2 group are married women who are on average 38 years of age with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, a village in the municipality of Wateni in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and previous loans have been duly repaid.

Korotoumou, who is standing in the middle, grows corn. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain one hectare (2.47 acres).

After harvesting, the production is sold in the village and at the Sikasso market, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to achieve an average profit of 75,000 FCFA per growing season. The profits will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Rebhi

texts.en:
Rebhi is a married man who is 43 years old and a father of three sons and three daughters. For the past year, Rebhi has had a coffee shop. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs. 

Rebhi is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new ice cream machine and a refrigerator for his business. This will enable Rebhi to increase his income. Rebhi is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to buy a new ice cream machine and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ma. Leonora

texts.en:
This is Ms. Leonora. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories as well as for the maintenance of her jeepney unit (the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines). Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Leonora would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. The profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for her children's education. Leonora looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ms. Leonora hopes to expand her business and dreams of living a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

- Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers in helping the Philippines ward off the invading Japanese. Filipinos, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn money and modified the Jeep into a 20-seat jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a wife and mother of three school-going children. For one and a half years, she has been running a salon. Catherine has employed one other person who helps her serve her customers. She knew of Milango through a friend. 

Catherine seeks a loan of 21,100 KES to buy chemicals and plaiting weaves. In five years' time, she wants to have opened other branches of the same business. The challenges she faces include bad debts, rent and the high cost of the materials she uses. The income will help her educate her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and plaiting weaves.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es:
Santos,  está muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le dieron atravez de su anterior financiamiento, pues le ayudo a pagar el alquiler de tierras para sembrar tabaco y comprar insumos para darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus siembras y reparar una parte de las galeras donde almacena tabaco.  

En este nuevo préstamo piensa invertirlo  para darle mantenimiento y reparación a la galera donde almacena la hoja de tabaco pues necesita comprar madera, plastico y pagar mano d obra, ya que año con año tiene que realizar esta labor porque la madera y el plástico no duran más tiempo y necesita almacenar su producto en buenas condiciones para poder venderlo a un buen precio a las empresas tabacaleras. Uno de sus siguientes pasos es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa para que su familia tenga un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Santos feels grateful for the opportunity he was given through the previous loan. The loan helped him to pay for the rent of land where he grows tobacco and for some supplies needed to give maintenance to his crops and fix a barn where he stores the tobacco.

He is planning to invest this new loan in the maintenance and repairing of the barn where he stores the tobacco leaves. He needs to buy wood, plastic film and pay for labor. Santos has to do this every year, since the wood and plastic get worn easily and he needs to store his produce under good conditions in order to get a good price from the tobacco companies. His next step is to improve his house in order to provide his family with a dignified place where to live.

loans.use: to buy wood, plastic film and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Damaris trabaja desde hace 12 años  en el área de limpieza de una universidad de Managua, vive en un barrio al sur de la capital. Casada con dos hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.

Doña Damaris está solicitando un crédito a kiva para hacerle algunas mejorar al área de su cocina y comedor esto lo hace con el fin de mejorar un poco su casa y brindarles mayor comodidad a su familia.

Agradece a kiva y ceprodel ya con los crédito que le hemos otorgado ha mejorado bastante su casa que con mucho esfuerzo ha venido construyendo con amor para sus hijos
texts.en:
Damaris has worked for 12 years as a cleaner at the University of Managua.  She lives in a neighborhood south of the capital.  She is married and has two school-age children.

Damaris is seeking a loan from Kiva so that she can make improvements to her kitchen and bathroom.  She is making these repairs so that she can improve her home and provide more comfort for her family.

She is thankful to Kiva and Ceprodel for granting the loan because she puts a lot of effort into making a loving home for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara del Carmen es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, como toda sauceña es digna de admirarla por luchar cada día y el entusiasmo con el que desempeña su labor para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y pagar los estudios de su hijo que estudia el tercer año de secundaria.

Desempeña el cargo de recepcionista desde hace doce años labor que le gusta desempeñar porque cuenta con el carisma de atender de manera muy amable a las personas que visitan la empresa para la cual trabaja.

Desde hace varios meses se ha sentido mal de salud, padeciendo de una serie de enfermedades que le han afectado en su vida cotidiana y por lo tanto en su trabajo y desea mejorarla tratando a tiempo este problema.

Para ello está solicitando un crédito en Ceprodel con el apoyo de los fondos Kiva con el fin de comprar la medicina necesaria para tratarse esta enfermedad, realizarse ultrasonidos y pagar consultas médicas, ya que no cuenta con un ahorro necesario solamente con su bajo salario que cubre solo para la alimentación.

Es por ello que recurre a esta oficina para que le apoyen con su solicitud donde quedará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen is a native of the town of El Sauce. Like all "sauceña", it is worth admiring her for fighting every day and the enthusiasm with which she works hard at her job to bring home the daily bread and to pay for the education of her son who is in the third year of secondary school.

She has worked as a receptionist for twelve years, a job that she likes to do because she has the charisma to attend in a friendly manner to people who visit the company for which she works.

For several months, she has felt unwell, suffering from a series of illnesses that have affected her daily life and, as a result, her job and she wishes to improve giving this problem time.

For this she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel with the support of Kiva with the goal of buying the necessary medicine to treat this illness, perform ultrasounds and pay medical consultants since she does not have the necessary savings. With her low salary she can only cover food.

It is for this that she returns to this office so that you support her with her request and for which she will remain eternally grateful.

loans.use: to buy medicines, get ultrasounds and pay medical consultants.

loans.name: Ana Jhacqueline

texts.es: La Sra.  Ana tiene 21 años, se dedica  a la   venta de ropa medias panty nylon para mujeres y niñas, ella tiene un puesto fijo en la zona Mariano Mamani ,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra.  Ana va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de ropa medias  por mayor y de esta manera brindar variedad de ropa  a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias, y si le sobra un saldo comprara electrodomésticos para su casa,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra.  Ana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de medias, La Sra.  Ana es una persona joven y muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que le dan la oportunidad de crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is 21 years old and her business is selling ladies' and girls' pantyhose (sheer nylon tights).  She has a permanent sales location in Mariano Mamani district where she offers her products for sale.  This loan is her first through the institution.  Ana will use her loan to buy tights wholesale so that she can offer her customers a good variety and increase her profits.  If she has any money left over, she will buy electrical appliances for her home.  Ana is requesting this loan so that she can continue improving her business.  She will use her profits to continue buying a range of tights.  Ana is a very hard-working young person and she feels happy for this opportunity as she is being given the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy pantyhose (sheer nylon tights)

loans.name: Marlene Lizzette

texts.es: Marlene, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija con quien vive en un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Marlene lleva cuatro años de tener su propio negocio después de haber trabajado por varios años en una maquila. Cuenta con un salón de belleza donde presta los servicios de alisado, corte, planchado y tintes de cabello, además hace limpieza facial, manicure y pedicura. Ella ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 Lempiras porque quiere surtir de productos de belleza de dos casas comerciales, de champú, tintes, cremas,  tratamientos y otros. Tiene planeado conseguir otro local y establecer el salón mas grande y vender comidas.
texts.en:
Marlene, 41, is a single mother. She has a daughter and they live together in the municipality of Choloma, Cortés. Marlene has had this business for four years. Before, she worked for a maquila [factories normally operating in a free trade zone, assembling, processing or manufacturing for export]. Marlene offers different types of services in her salon: hair straightening, styling, ironing and coloring. She also does facial cleansing, manicure and pedicure.

Marlene has decided to request a loan of 8,000 Lempiras [HNL] with the intention to stock her salon with products from two different brands: shampoo, dyes, creams and other beauty products. She is planning to move her salon into a larger establishment and start selling food.

loans.use: to stock her salon with beauty products such as shampoo, dyes and creams.

loans.name: Francisco Jacob

texts.es:
Francisco Jacob es un joven de 21 años originario del municipio de El Sauce que a pesar de ser tan joven es muy responsable y obligado con su madre, trata de ayudarle en lo más que puede económicamente, ya que ella trabaja duramente como empleada doméstica para mantener al resto de sus hijos.

Este joven ayuda a su madre a llevar el pan de cada día y laborar como operario de limpieza donde a diario se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para iniciar a barrer las diferentes calles del municipio.

 A pesar de ganar tan poco que su salario solo alcanza para la alimentación lo ejerce con dedicación y empeño porque se siente agradecido con Dios y su empleador por tener este trabajo digno cuando hay muchos en Nicaragua que aguantan hambre por la falta de empleo.

Por primera vez se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con fondos Kiva con el fin de Comprar medicamentos para su mamá, ya que tiene la necesidad de mejorar su salud y solo así podría lograrlo con la ayuda de este financiamiento.
Espera con gran fé la ayuda de estos inversionistas que es de primordial importancia mejorar la salud de su mamá.
texts.en:
Francisco Jacob is a young 21 years old and he is from the El Sauce neighborhood.  In spite of being so young, he is very responsible and dedicated to his mother.  He tries to help her as much as he can financially, since she works hard as a domestic worker in order to support the rest of her children.

This young man helps his mother bring home the bread every day.  He works as a street cleaner and every morning gets up at 4 AM to begin cleaning the different streets in his neighborhood.

In spite of the fact that his salary is very low, he is dedicated and tries his best because he feels thankful to God and his employer that he has this dignified work while there are so many people in Nicaragua that go hungry because they don't have jobs. 

For the first time, he came to Ceprodel to seek a loan with funding from Kiva so that he can buy medicine for his mother.  She needs to improve her health and she will only be able to get better with the help from this financing.

He believes with great faith that the financial help from the investors is of paramount importance to improve his mother's health.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his mother.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 10 y 16 años. Ella se dedica a la venta  de frutas, entre otros productos;  el negocio lo inicia a raíz de la necesidad  para sacar adelante a sus hijos en los estudios y para los gastos del hogar, al principio lo realizo de forma ambulante y después alquilando un puesto en la Alcaldía hasta la fecha.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar frutas  tales como: naranjas, mangos, sandias, melon, piña, entre otros;  este le ayudara  a proveerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, adquirir nueva mercadería.
Su sueño es incrementar sus ventas para así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children who are 10 and 16 years old.  Her business is selling fruit and other products.  She started her business as she needed to support her children's education and cover her household expenses.  At first she worked as an itinerant street vendor then later rented a stall in town where she currently works.

The loan that María is requesting will allow her to buy fruit such as oranges, mangos, watermelon, melon and pineapples.  This will help her to acquire new merchandise and provide her family with a better quality of life.  Her dream is to increase her sales and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mangos, watermelon, melon, pineapple and other fruit

loans.name: Mirian Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mirian, es una mujer emprendedora,  trabaja de conserje  desde hace 26 años en un Instituto de la localidad también tiene otro negocio como es  la venta de  zapatos, perfumenes, brassieres y blúmeres, esto con el objetivo de tener otros ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que el salario de conserje es bajo y con esta otra alternativa económica pues tienen otras condiciones, es soltera 

Actualmente esta señora tiene la urgencia de ser favorecida con un financiamiento, por eso llego a las oficinas de ceprodel, el que utilizaría en la compra de zapatos, perfumenes, brassieres y blúmeres y comercializarlos y de esa manera cubrir algunas necesidades personales agradeciéndole por su buen gesto a ceprodel y a los inversionistas de kiva, por brindarle el apoyo oportuno y necesario a  los sectores mas pobres.
texts.en:
Mirian is an entrepreneurial woman who, for the past 26 years, has worked as a janitor in a school in her town.  She also has a business selling shoes, perfume, bras and underpants with the aim of making additional income in order to improve her living conditions as her janitor's salary is low and she needs the extra income to improve her living conditions.  She is single.

Mirian currently needs a loan and so she came to Ceprodel's offices.  She will use her loan to buy shoes, perfume, bras and underwear which she will then re-sell.  This will enable her to cover some personal needs.  She is grateful for Ceprodel and Kiva lenders' goodwill, for giving the poorest people the support they need when they need it.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfume, bras and underpants

loans.name: Einice

texts.en:
Einice is married and blessed with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She sells tea leaves at the market, selling to town dwellers and passersby. She cites high cost of transportation as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase five sacks of tea leaves to sell to earn a living. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 44-year-old woman living in a remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has five children and her husband is working as a carpenter. The monthly income of her husband is insufficient to meet the household expenses due to the large family size, therefore Nabeela is helping her husband by doing her own business. She has been successfully running her business of selling ornamental items for six years.  

Nabeela has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. She would purchase a large quantity and new varieties of bangles, bracelets, necklaces, key chains and other ornamental items and sell them at a profit. This could increase her sales, monthly income and savings and she could support her family in better way. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase bangles, bracelets, etc

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael. He previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that he used for purchasing necessary products and materials for the beauty parlor.  His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy products like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil and other products needed for hair care in his parlor. His profits from business will definitely help cover his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Michael hopes to expand his business and dreams of having a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil, etc.

loans.name: Zarqa's Group

texts.en:
Zarqa is 23 years old, a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband. Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. Zarqa is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010 she has been operating her own beauty salon. 

Currently the beauty stock of the salon is almost finished, therefore Zarqa wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that reason, as a member of 2-person borrower group she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, make-up kits, hair colors and some other products. She would also buy some new chairs for her salon.  

Zarqa dreams of llving a happy healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.
. 
Note: In the picture Zarqa is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Uranchimeg, 44 years old, lives with her daughter in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. They live in a small room originally designed for a public water closet. Her son studies at university in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She is a street vendor who sells small items such as ice creams, juices and candies. Her daughter is currently unemployed and stays at home. 

Mrs. Uranchimeg is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to pay her son's tuition fees and dormitory cost. She wants her son to study well and secure a good paying job after graduation. The borrower is very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her children and is eager to invest in their education.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees and dormitory cost

loans.name: Kato Allama 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    KATO ALLAMA 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bougoulaba, un des villages de la commune de Wateni dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.  
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide avec Adiara debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences  et les engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kato Allama 3 group are married women, who are, on average, 38 years old and have four children. All live in polygamous families in Bougoulaba, one of the villages in the Wateni commune of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their farming during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with this institution. All of their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Adiara, standing in the middle [of the photo], grows ground nuts. With this loan, she expects to buy seeds and fertilizers to maintain one hectare of land. 
After the harvest, she hopes to sell her crop in a Sikasso village market to men and women customers.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 35,000 francs CFA per crop harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz et le pois sucré avec  MOUSSOKOURA 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women.  They are, on average, 37 years old and have three children, and all live in traditional families in Niantanso, one of the villages of the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their agricultural activities during the winter. 
They are on their 7th agricultural loan with the institution and all the previous loans have been properly repaid. 
They plan, among other things, to grow peanuts, rice, and sweet peas, as does Moussokoura, the first person sitting to the left in the photo.  With her loan, she plans to buy fertilizer and to pay the labor costs necessary to maintain one hectare. 
The produce is sold in the villages after the harvest to male and female customers. 
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA per field.
This income will allow her to pay off the loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
This is Shirley, 37, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roderick, a driver, and a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages a household while operating her business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Shirley maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers receive as income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a 19,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, and undergarments. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Shirley dreams of being successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es originaria de la bella ciudad de Estelí conocida como la capital de tabaco ubicada en el norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es casada tiene dos hijos en edad escolar cursando la primaria, esta joven demuestra tener buenos valores morales, su profesión es licenciada en matemática.

Actualmente se desempeña como docente de secundaria en un colegio rural, su trabajo consiste en facilitar la asignatura de matemática a más de 300 alumnos en diferentes niveles escolares., También imparte clase los fines de semana en dos universidades.

Solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como piso cerámica y cemento a la misma vez agradece a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
