Gladys is from the beautiful city of Estelí, known as the tobacco capital, located in northern Nicaragua. She is married and has two school aged children in primary school. This young woman has good moral values. She has a degree in mathematics.

Right now, she works as a teacher in a rural high school. Her job is teaching mathematics to more than 300 students at different learning levels. She also teaches classes weekends at two universities.

She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as ceramic floor and cement. She is grateful to Kiva for the help it has given since it means she will be able to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy a ceramic floor and cement.

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans et 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz et le pois sucré avec  DJENEBOU avant dernière personne à droite de la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married woman who, on average, are 35 years old and have four children. All live in traditional families in Niantanso, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry our their farming during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution, and all of their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Djenbou, the last person seated on the right in the photo, grows, among other things, ground nuts, rice, and sweet peas. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to maintain one hectare [of land]. After the harvest, she will sell her crop in the village to men and women customers.

She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 90,000 francs CFA per crop harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband in the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Mayerly

texts.es:
Mayerly es una maestra, con más de diez años de experiencia, casada, madre de tres hijos en edad escolar. 

Habita en el municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón y se siente muy orgullosa de pertenecer a este municipio y orgullosa de ser originaria de un pueblito tan sencillo y luchador. 

Gracias a todos los créditos que le ha financiado Ceprodel con fondos de los inversionistas Kiva ha mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda, hoy tiene mejores condiciones de vida ella y su familia y por lo tanto un mejor nivel de vida.

Actualmente quiere construir un pequeño cuartito para descansar en mejores condiciones con sus tres hijitos que tanto ama y estima, por tan razón solicita su pequeño crédito para la compra de ladrillo, cemento y arena. 

Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel aprobarán su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Mayerly is a teacher, with more than ten years of experience. She is married and the mother of three school aged children.

She lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón and she is proud to belong to this town and proud to be from a little town that is so humble and resilient. 

Thanks to the loans that have been given to her through Ceprodel with funds from Kiva investors, she has improved her living conditions. Today she and her family have better living conditions and therefore a better quality of life.

Right now, she wants to build a little room to be able to rest in better conditions with her three children, whom she loves and esteems so much. That is why she is asking for this small loan to buy bricks, cement and sand. 

She trusts in God that the Kiva and Ceprodel investors will approve her application so she can make her investment.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Benkadi  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  30 ans et 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz et le pois sucré avec  FANTA deuxième personne à gauche de la photo position débout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women who, on average, are 30 years old and have two children. All live in traditional families in Niantanso, a village in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso). They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry our their farming during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution, and all of their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Fanta, the second person standing on the left in the photo, grows, among other things, ground nuts, rice, and sweet peas. With this loan, she plans to buy farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to maintain half a hectare [of land]. 

After the harvest, she sells her crops in the village to men and women customers. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 francs CFA per crop harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fabio Ricardo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, El señor Fabio, se dedica arduamente a la labor como maestro de Educación Física, en un pequeño Instituto del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 22 años, es Casado con 3 hijos a los que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Una de las necesidades que el Señor  Fabio, atraviesa hoy en día, es de mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales  de construcción como zinc, perlines, cemento y mano de obra, para realizar las mejoras en la casa, para mayor seguridad de su vivienda. Por medio de esta obra brindará mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the town of Telica, department of León, Fabio works hard as a physical education teacher in a little public institution. He has done this for 22 years. HE is married and has 3 children, whom he has to give the best conditions for their development. 

One of the things that Fabio needs today is to improve his living conditions because his home is in poor condition. That is why he has made the decision to turn to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials such as zinc sheeting, metal bars, cement and to pay for labor costs to do the home improvement in order to have more security there. With this construction work, he will offer a better quality of life to his children.

loans.use: to buy materials such as zinc sheeting, metal bars, cement and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Twakl Group

texts.en: This group is called Twakl,and it consists of four ladies. They work hard to offer a good life for their family. They took out a loan of 200,000 YER. Fahmia, one of the members, is a 33-year-old married woman who has two children. She lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has a house and she wants to renovate it, but she does not have enough money, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials like iron and cement. She hopes to buy furniture for her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like iron and cement to renovate her house.

loans.name: Pasiencia

texts.en:
This is Pasiencia. She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Pasiencia hopes that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is a mother of five children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. 

Her husband is doing the business of construction supplies. Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. With the help of loan, her husband will purchase bricks, cement and other construction material and then sell it for a profitable amount in the main market. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future.

 Zahida is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is a husband and a father of two school-going children. 

For seven years he has been selling shoes in the locality. Daniel also owns a house on which he collects rental income at the end of the month.

He knew Milango through a relative and now he seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy 15 pairs of shoes for resale. 

He faces a challenge of pricing. He wants to own a wholesale shop that will be supplying shoes to the whole city. His family will have a better life, especially after the loan term.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 43 years old and is the responsible mother of four children. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and children. Her husband is a janitor in a hospital but his salary is not enough to meet the household expenses. He wants to start his own work. 

Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would purchase a rickshaw from the loan amount and he would drive the rickshaw at night along with his present job. In this way, his monthly income would be increased and they would be able to send their children to schools.

Naseem is very hopeful for this loan and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Santos Eusebio

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos, tiene 35 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 hijos, quienes están estudiando actualmente, vive en la aldea que pertenece al municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Santos tiene cuatro años de tener un negocio de venta de ropa para damas y niños, gorras, chinola, fajas, sandalias, bolsos y zapatos. Esta actividad la realiza a diario, pero el sábado y domingo vende en un puesto de venta En Taulabe, es una aldea cercana de su casa. Ya tiene su clientela establecida.
Este negocio lo inicio con dinero propio, y las ganancias las ha reinvertido para ir incrementando su inventario.
Este préstamo es el tercer ciclo con ODEF, es el segundo con Kiva, es por la cantidad de 21,000 Lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de mercadería como ropa, zapatos, fajas, plásticos, y achinería general.  Su meta es poder ampliar el negocio para obtener mayores ingresos para cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is 35 years old, married and has three children who are currently in school.  He lives in a small village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Santos has been running a business selling ladies' and children's clothing for four years.  He sells hats, belts, sandals, bags and shoes.  He works every day but on Saturdays and Sundays he sells from a sales location in Taulabe, a nearby village.  He already has an established customer base.  He started the business with his own money and has reinvested his profits in increasing his stock.

This loan is Santos' third through ODEF and his second through Kiva.  It is for 21,000 lempiras which he will invest in buying merchandise such as clothing, shoes, belts, plastic goods and general merchandise.  His goal is to expand his business so that he can make more income with which to cover his children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, belts, shoes and plastic goods

loans.name: Agricultores De Tzucubal Group

texts.es:
José (playera celeste en la foto) es el líder del Grupo Agricultores de Tzucubal(Buscador en lengua nativa del lugar) es un señor  de 50 años de edad quien  tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 son hombres y 4 mujeres, ellos viven en la Aldea Tzucubal, municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá.
El es agricultor, las actividades agrícolas que realiza son: cultivo de maíz, arveja y café, todo esto lo realiza en su parcela ubicada en la aldea donde vive, realiza estas actividades porque a través de ellos genera ingresos  suficientes para el sostenimiento de su familia, tiene 35 años de estarlos realizando.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizante para el cultivo de su maíz.
Sueña con mejorar su casa de habitación para darle a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
José (in the blue t-shirt in the photo) is the leader of the "Agricultures de Tzucubal"  group.  He is 50 years old and has six children: two boys and four girls.  They live in the Tzucubal village in the municipality of Nahualá, in the Sololá department.  José is a farmer and works growing corn, coffee and peas on his plot of land in the village.  He does this work because it earns him enough money to support his family.  He has been doing this work for over 35 years.

José is applying for a loan in order to buy fertiliser for his corn crops.

His dream is to improve his house so that he can give his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser for corn crops.

loans.name: Angela Lucia

texts.es: La Señora Angela trabaja para un preescolar publico desde hace mas de 15 años como maestra impartiendo clase a niños de 5 a 6 años, actualmente esta tramitando gastos de diplomas de educación superior, se siente agradecida por ceprodel por por el apoyo que le puedan brindar  facilitado un crédito
texts.en: Angela has been working as a nursery school teacher for over fifteen years, working with children aged five to six years old.  She is currently processing her higher education diploma and needs to pay for this.  She feels grateful to "Ceprodel" for the support they are providing through this loan.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of her diploma.

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali is a 46-year-old married father of nine children. He lives in a small village in Southern Lebanon with his wife and seven of his children. 

He owns a business where he trades and sells spare parts and tires, and washes cars. His wife is unemployed, and his children are still at school, which makes him the only provider and financial resource of the family. His monthly revenue is barely enough to cover half of his expenses, but nevertheless, all his children are enrolled in a public school. 

Given the fact that Mohammad has nine children, enhancing and improving his business is one of his priorities. He contacted Al Majmoua for a third time in order to acquire a loan. This time, he needs to borrow a loan in order to purchase tires and oil and other merchandise for his business. It would without a doubt be of great benefit for him.

loans.use: to purchase tires and oil and other merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Ganzaya

texts.en:
Ganzaya, 29 years old, lives with her husband and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. The family resides in apartment. 

Her husband has been working as an internal auditor for many years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. She has been selling religious items such as juniper, charms and birth stones to local people at a trade center. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile that runs on natural gas. A natural gas vehicle has cleaner emissions and less fuel wastage compared with other engines. The borrower will use this automobile for goods transportation and it will save time and increase efficiency.

loans.use: to purchase a natural gas vehicle to transport her goods to market.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes operates a clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. 

She says her major challenge is the rate of stock turnover, which is affected by seasons. 

Here she comes to you again for another loan of KES 20,000 to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  B Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  NOUPAGAGNON B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  45 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  AWA  1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group NOUPAGAGNON B are married women who average 45 years of age and three children each. They all live in traditional families in KOLOKOBA, a village of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali).

They partnered with the Yoro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 7th farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso, and all past loans were correctly repaid. 

AWA grows groundnuts, rice, maize, and peppers.She is sitting first from the left in the photo. Awa will use her loan to buy inputs and to pay for the cost of plowing one hectare of land. 

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the village to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Awa expects to earn an average profit of 200,000FCFA per campaign. This will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of inputs and plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the processing of her university title.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Ricardo trabaja para un centro de salud publico desde hace mas de 15 años en el area de control de epidemias, actualmente se le ha presentado problemas de salud donde tiene que realizarse una serie de examenes medicos como ultrasonidos, radiografias y compra de medicamente, se siente agradecido por ceprodel ya que le facilito el credito para realizar esos gastos
texts.en: Ricardo has been working for a public health centre for over fifteen years.  He works in epidemic control and has recently been suffering from health problems.  As a result he needs to go through a series of tests, such as an ultrasound, x-rays and to buy medication.  He is grateful to "Ceprodel" for providing a loan to cover these costs.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams such as ultrasounds.

loans.name: Francisca Paula

texts.es: La señora Francisca trabaja para un centro de salud publico desde hace mas de 20 años en el área de higiene y limpieza publica, actualmente se le ha otorgado un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, ladrillos, zinc y otros para remplazar la construcción de una cocina ya que la que tiene actualmente se le presenta dificultades en el invierno, se siente agradecido por facilitarle el préstamo
texts.en: Francisca has been working for a public health centre for over twenty years.  She works in the hygiene and public cleaning section.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, zinc sheets and more, in order to replace her current kitchen, which is not fully functional in the winter.  Francisca is grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and more.

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es: Liliam es una mujer microempresaria de éxito, tiene 36 años de edad, soltera y con hijo menor, su negocio es una pulpería que tiene desde hace dos años sus productos los comercializa en su comunidad donde es la mayoría de su clientela, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, jabón de lavar ropa, jabón de baño, jabon de lavar trastos, carne de res, carne de pollo, sal, sopas maggi, medicamentos  populares, pan simple, queso, crema etc.
texts.en: Liliam is a successful microentrepreneur.  She is 36 years old, single and has a young son.  She has had a grocery store for two years and sells her products in her own community, which is where most of her customers are.  Liliam will invest this loan in buying grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, soap for washing clothes, hand soap, meat, chicken, salt, Maggi soups, common medicines, bread, cheese, cream and more.

loans.use: to buy grains such as rice and beans, sugar, oil, toilet paper, soap for washing clothes, hand soap, meat, chicken, salt, Maggi soups, common medicines, bread, cheese, cream and more.

loans.name: Ebda Group

texts.en:
The Ebda group is four ladies who applied for a loan of 200,000 YER. They live in Taiz, Yemen. 

Hayam is the leader of this group. She is a 33-year-old married woman who has four children, living in a poor area. She is a housewife who feels tired of meeting the household needs. She is in a bad situation but tries her best to raise her children well. 

She has applied for a loan to buy furniture to use in her house. She hopes to open for her family a saving account to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use in her house.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: La Señora. María trabaja en un centro de salud publico como conserje desde hace mas de 20 años, actualmente solicita un crédito para la mejora de una cocina ya que en invierno se le ha presentado problemas, se siente muy agradecido con ceprodel  por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, ya que así va  poder realizar esa mejora y darle una mejor comodidad a su familia
texts.en: María has been working as a janitor in a public health centre for over twenty years.  She is currently applying for a loan in order to improve her kitchen as in the winter she has problems with it.  María is very grateful to "Ceprodel" for the help they can provide.  It is with this loan that she will be able to make these improvements to her home and give her family a better living situation.

loans.use: to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Geronima Migdalia

texts.es: La Señora Geronima trabaja para una escuela publica como maestra desde hace mas de 15 años impartiendo clases en niños de 10 a 12 años, actualmente solicita  un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion como ladrillos, cemento y hierro para la elaboracion de un dormitorio brindandole una mejor condicion de vida a su familia, se siente agradecida con ceprodel y espera le puedan apoyar  facilitado el credito
texts.en: Señora Geronima has worked for a public school as a teacher for more than 15 years, teaching classes for children between 10 and 12 years old.  Now she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like bricks, cement, and iron for the construction of a bedroom to offer better living conditions for her family.  She is grateful to Ceprodel and hopes they will be able to help provide the loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like bricks, iron, and other things.

loans.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es:
Silvia, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa tales como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ganancias y con ello logro apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Silvia needs a new loan as she requires more working capital in order to continue with her business.  This loan will allow her to buy a variety of clothing items, including blouses, skirts, trousers and underwear.

Silvia's previous loan helped her to increase her income and, with it, she was able to support her family with household costs.  Her family's circumstances and financial situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, trousers, underwear and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La Sra. Antonia  tiene 46 años y tiene un hijo que tiene la edad de 13  años, la Sra. Antonia se dedica a la  venta de comida, ella vende pollo broaster,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Antonia utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de asador para pollo a la broaster por su negocio la razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de dinero, para la compra de una brostera que mucha falta le hace e n su negocio, la Sra. Antonia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son incrementar su clientela para así generar mayores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar cosas para su hogar y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Antonia is 46 years old and has a thirteen-year-old son.  Antonia makes a living selling fried chicken.  This loan is part of her first cycle with the lending institution and it will be used to buy a roaster for making the fried chicken for her business.  She is applying for this loan because she does not have the money to pay for this much needed roaster.  Antonio is facing challenges in her business, such as increasing her number of customers in order to generate a higher income.  She will use the profits to buy items for her home and thus improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a roaster.

loans.name: Norma Azucena

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer emprendedora, docente, además de ser maestra de educación primaria,  realiza el trabajo de su hogar. es casada con 1 hijo al que le está brindando el apoyo como toda madre quiere lo mejor para sus hijos, en la superación del nivel académico.

Actualmente esta señora tiene la urgencia de ser favorecida con un financiamiento, por eso llego a las oficinas de ceprodel, el que utilizaría en la compra de de zinc, perlines, golosos, hierro, cemento y mano de obra  agradeciéndole por su buen gesto a ceprodel y a los inversionistas por brindarle el apoyo oportuno y necesario a  los sectores más pobres y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Norma is an enterprising woman and a teacher.  As well as working in a primary school, she looks after her home.  She is married and has one son. As every mother wants the best for her children. Norma supports her son in his academic work.

Norma is currently in urgent need of a loan and so has come to the "Ceprodel" offices.  She will use the loan to buy zinc, purlins, gloss, iron, cement and to pay for labourers.  She is thankful to "Ceprodel" for their kind gesture and to lenders for providing necessary and appropriate support to the poorest areas, thus improving people's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc, purlins, gloss, iron, cement and to pay for labourers

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
This is Anabelle. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more fruits, thus generating more income. The loan also helped in the education of her children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Anabelle would like to apply for another PHP 30,000 loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Anabelle hopes that her children will finish their studies and she dreams to expand her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. She also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 35-year-old, married man living in his hometown city in the south of Lebanon. He owns a small sanitary shop, which is his only source of financial gain. His wife is currently unemployed, which renders Husein to be the only provider of the household. 

This is actually the fifth time that he has contacted Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development to acquire a loan. In fact, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development has previously helped him by giving him a loan to build his house and establish his new family. 

He needs this loan in order to be able to purchase a new refrigerator and a television, in order to continue renovating his living room. He wishes to complete the process before thinking about having children and going forward with his life. As for the future, Husein hopes that Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development would help him expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator and a television, in order to continue renovating his living room.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena es una mujer dedicada a la enseñanza principalmente de los niños, ya que su profesión es  maestra de educación primaria, con 9 años  de desempeñarse como docente, es soltera, con 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, a quienes les da todo el apoyo para su desarrollo ,actualmente tiene una necesidad de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de bloques, cemento, zinc, transporte y mano de obra, la que le brindara mejores condiciones en su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha Lorena works teaching children as she is a primary school teacher, now with nine years experience.  She is single and has three children, for whom she is responsible.  She supports them fully in their development but she currently needs to improve the conditions of their home.  So, she has come to "Ceprodel" to benefit for a loan that she will use to buy bricks, cement and zinc and to pay for transport and labour costs.  This will give provide better conditions in her home.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and zinc and to pay for transport and labour costs.

loans.name: Maria Neisa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  tiene 22 años y tiene dos hijos que tienen las edades de 2 y 3 años,  ella se dedica a la  venta de juguetes en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria  va a usar este préstamo para compra de juguetes por mayor para surtir su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es crecimiento de su negocio, la Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la mismo mercado donde vende existen varias personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar sus productos y su calidad de vida. Su deseo  para su negocio es montar una tienda propia y poder exponer la variedad de juguetes que tiene para la venta.
texts.en: Maria is 22 years old and has two children who are 2 and 3.  Her business is selling toys from her sales stall in the town of El Torno.  This loan is Maria's first through the institution.  She will use it to buy toys wholesale to stock her business.  She is requesting the loan to grow her business.  Maria faces challenges such as competition as there are a number of people running the same kind of business in the market where she sells her products.  She will use the profits she makes to improve her products and her quality of life.  Her business goal is to set up her own store where she can properly display the range of toys she has for sale.

loans.use: to buy toys wholesale

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has eight children. She lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She has been frying fish and selling to the locals for more than 10 years. She employs one person who helps her run the business.

Khadija is requesting a loan from Milango for 21,100 KES, which she will use to buy fish and 20 liters of cooking oil to allow her to reach more customers. The major challenges she faces are bad debts and transportation issues. In the future, Khadija would like to supply fish to other places.

loans.use: to purchase fish and 20 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: Amparo de 51 años de edad, aprendió el oficio de la confección por tradición familiar. Radicada en una vereda del municipio de Rionegro, se dedica a realizar los trajes de sus vecinos y amigos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y años de trabajo, Amparo creó  un pequeño taller en su vivienda en donde labora diariamente, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos como telas con el fin de garantizar un buen servicio y aumentar su capacidad de producción, generando mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en: 51-year-old Amparo learned dressmaking by family tradition.  Located in a village in Rionegro, Amparo works making outfits for her friends and neighbors.  As a result of her efforts and years of hard work, she was able to set up a small workshop in her home where she works every day.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as fabric so that she can guarantee her customers a good service and increase her production capacity.  This will make her more income and she will be able to improve her household's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric

loans.name: Lennin Alexander

texts.es:
Lennin es un joven  emprendedor  que siempre se ha destacado por la mejoría de su empresa o centro de trabajo, de profesión Auxiliar de Contabilidad  y le gusta poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos manteniendo en orden su empresa  y durante cuatro años  ha laborado en la misma. 

Actualmente está  solicitando un pequeño financiamiento, para la construcción de su vivienda, y lo utilizara para compra de ladrillos, arena, cemento, piedrín, perlines, zinc, puertas, ventanas, y mano de obra por lo tanto le agradece a ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno para realizar sus sueños, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Lennin is an enterprising young man who always stands out for the improvement of his business or workplace.  His is by profession an assistant accountant, and he likes to put into practice his acquired knowledge by keeping his company in order and for four years he has worked doing the same.

Now he is requesting a small loan for the construction of his home and he will use it to buy bricks, sand, cement, gravel, roof purlins, zinc, doors, windows, and manual labor.  Therefore, he is grateful to Ceprodel for the timely support to realize his dreams; this way he will improve his conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To buy brick, sand, cement, gravel, roof purlins, zinc, doors, windows, and manual labor.

loans.name: Enoc Alberto

texts.es: El señor Enoc es un hombre dedicado a impartir el pan de la enseñanza principalmente a los Jóvenes, ya que es maestro de educación Técnica de un Instituto de la comunidad donde habita, es soltero, este señor se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para plantear una necesidad urgente de terminar la construcción de su vivienda, solicitando un financiamiento para utilizarlo en la compra de Cemento,  Arena, puertas, y verjas, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Enoc is a man that works to educate young people as a vocational teacher in an institute in the community where he lives. He is single. 

He went to the offices of Ceprodel to discuss the urgent need to finish the construction of his house. He is requesting a loan to purchase cement, sand, doors, and wrought-iron grilles. 

This will improve his situation and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, doors, and wrought-iron grilles

loans.name: Rubi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RUBI”  iniciará el décimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: pastelería, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, producción de mandiles, tejido de chompas, costura de polleras, venta de cremas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos; este negocio lo emprendió con el préstamo que saco en Pro Mujer por recomendación de unas amigas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de plásticos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la atención del personal de crédito.

En la imagen falta una señora, porque tuvo que hacrse una consulta médica
texts.en:
Communal bank ”Rubi” will start its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Focal Center of Collpani. It has nine members, and is directed by a board of which Martha is the president. They all have different lines of work: baking, a grocery store, selling food, making aprons, knitting sweaters, sewing skirts, and selling creams.

This loan will help small entrepreneurs such as Martha. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years. She was invited by a friend who is also a member. Martha currently sells plastic items, a business she started with a loan she received from Pro Mujer, following her friends’ advice.

With this loan, Martha will buy more plastic items at the fairs in the city of Oruro. After processing them, she will sell them in her establishment. With this activity she generates resources to support her family. She is married and has three daughters. 

She says that what she likes the most about Pro Mujer is the good service that the staff at the loans division gives her.

One of the members had a medical appointment and is not in the picture.

loans.use: to buy plastic items.

loans.name: Cenita

texts.en: Cenita is 49 years old and lives in the mountainous region of Isabela. She is married and has earned a living for the last eight years by making pots. In order to earn more money, she is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more of the clay, wood and other materials she needs for her business. Cenita is a very kind person and is determined to meet the needs of her family. If she can earn and save enough money from her business, she hopes to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy clay, wood and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 59-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 8 kids and her husband has been operating an automobile workshop for 15 years. They are facing financial problems due to his low monthly income.

Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business so that their income and savings would be increased. The main purpose of the loan is that her husband could buy new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base would be increased if he has the latest equipment and tools. In the future, with the profit amount, he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it.

Balqees is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems of her family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her husband's automobile workshop.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, es una persona honesta y honrada, vive con su familia, su esposa y su hijo de 10 meses de edad. El se dedica a la fabricación de machetes y barras metálicas, inicio este oficio tras observar la necesidad de los campesinos, hoy en día lo vende por pedidos y un puesto que tiene en el mercado, este lo heredo de su familia.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar hierro, carbón y adquirir la materia necesario para la elaboración de machetes; este le ayudara a incrementar la producción y por ende aumentar las ventas, asimismo la satisfacción de los clientes.
Su sueño es que el negocio le genere una buena rentabilidad y con ello brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, an honest and honorable person, lives with his family, his wife, and his 10-month-old son.  He makes a living through the manufacture of machetes and metal rods.  He began this work after observing the need of the farmers.  Today he sells via orders and a stall that he has in the market.  He inherited the stall from his family.

The loan he requires will allow him to buy iron and coal, and to acquire the necessary material for the manufacture of machetes.  This would help him to increase the production and therefore increase the sales, while doing the same for customer satisfaction.

His dream is for the business to generate good profitability and with it be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy iron and coal, and to acquire material.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is a widow and manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolanda operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells them by the kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Yolanda hopes to grow her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a widow and has one child, who is enrolled in the local school. She and her child live in a house they own that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She earns a living by selling khangas, a type of wrap-around garment for women. She goes door to door and sells them to neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is a lack of funds to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more khangas to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu to access the loans she needs to run and grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas to sell.

loans.name: Emerma

texts.en: Emerma is 43 years old and lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of one school-age child. For many years now she has earned a living by selling fish. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to  to buy new fishing nets. Emerma has been a member of GDMPC for two years, and her goal is to buy a new fishing boat in about two years.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Bellarmina

texts.es:
Bellarmina tienes 57 años de edad. Es una mujer emprendedora, que busca la manera de luchar por mejorar su calidad de vida. Radicada en una vereda del municipio de Lorica, esta mujer ha visto una oportunidad de negocio en la venta de carnes frías, la cual comenzó a desarrollar y de este modo generar ingresos. Hoy después de varios años, agradece a Dios la oportunidad que le ha dado de poder sacar a sus dos hijos adelante gracias a su trabajo. Desea mejorar el stock y garantizarles a sus clientes un buen servicio, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido como pollo y embutidos. 
Su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Bellarmina is 57 years of age. She is an enterprising woman in search of a way to effectively battle for a better quality of life. From her location on a sidewalk in the municipality of Lorica, Bellarmina has seen a business opportunity, selling frozen meats, which she began to develop hoping to generate income.

Now, after various years, thanks to the opportunity God has provided, she is able to better the lot of her 2 children, thanks to her work. She wants to improve her stock and guarantee her customers good service, the reason she is soliciting a loan for purchasing merchandise like chicken and sausages.

Bellarmina's greatest desire is to continue growing and expanding her business.

loans.use: buy frozen meats to sell.

loans.name: Carmen Edith

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 57 años de edad, es de procedencia humilde. Asegura que es una mujer trabajadora y echada para adelante. Manifiesta que las labores del hogar siempre han sido  su compañera ya que desde niña debía ayudarle a su madre con la elaboración de la comida. Posteriormente para ganarse la vida se empleó en un restaurante. Con la experiencia y con el deseo de un mejor futuro Carmen logró montar su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de comidas. 
Con el fin de mejorar el servicio y seguir creciendo en el sector, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar. Sueña tener su propio local y montar un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
57-year old Carmen is from a humble background. She tells us that she is a hardworking woman, keen to make progress in life. Household chores have always been a big part of her life as even as a child she had to help her mother prepare food. Later on she earned her living working in a restaurant. With this experience and a desire for a better future, Carmen managed to start her own business selling meals.

In order to improve service and continue growing her business, she is now seeking a loan to buy everyday food items. Her dream is to have her own premises and open a large restaurant.

loans.use: Buy food items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 2 children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for the children.

For the past 8 years she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation. With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  C Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  47 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  GNIRE 2ème personne à droite de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 210 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon C Group are married women with an average age of 47 years and and average of three children. They are all living in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh agricultural loan with the institution, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Gnire (shown in the photo second from the right, in the front row), grows crops of peanuts, rice, corn and peppers, among other things. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Gnire expects to earn an average income of 210,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow Gnire to repay her loan and to help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi, 23 years old, lives alone in Kutaisi district, West Georgia. Several times, he requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Givi’s mother is working abroad. She is sending transfers to Givi. Also, he is renting out rooms in his house to get a small monthly income.

Givi requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Givi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Givi will purchase a car. He will start driving it as a taxi and will serve local people, to earn additional daily income. Givi is a very hard-working man. He wants to start his own business and increase the family income. With the increased income, he will be able to improve his living conditions and provide a better future for himself.

loans.use: to purchase a car to drive as a taxi.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 49-year-old married mother. She has 11 children, six of whom are still living under her roof. She owns her own small bakery where she prepares Lebanese bread for the whole village. Her husband is a retired army officer, but his retirement salary is not enough to provide for his entire family. 

They have two children in a private school and two other children in a public school, which means they also have schooling expenses to settle on top of all the other expenses. Sending her children to school is very important for Sanaa because she wants them to have the opportunities that she unfortunately could not get, since the highest education she ever got was an elementary school degree. Thus, improving her socioeconomic situation would help her keep her children in school without it being a heavy burden on the family's shoulders. 

This is why she decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan. In fact, she needs to buy a new slicer machine that would facilitate the work in her bakery. She also needs to install a new balustrade in her house. In the future, Sanaa wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new slicer machine that would facilitate the work in her bakery. She also needs to install a new balustrade in her house.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto. His previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy the needed spare parts and to get maintenance done on his jeepney. He has been in this business for eighteen years now. He and his wife are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to get maintenance done on their Jeepney unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Alberto dreams of expanding his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Al-Sada Group

texts.en: The Al-Sada group consists of four women from Sana`a, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB. Suad is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is very hardworking and is doing his best to earn money. She intends to renovate her house. She decided to help her husband and applied for a loan of 60,000 YER to buy construction supplies to use for her house. She hopes that their life conditions will improve and that they will find capital to buy and sell products.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house.

loans.name: Chrescence Louise

texts.fr: Louise est une femme âgé de 55 ans, mère de famille. Elle a ouvert une alimentation  dans un quartier de la capitale qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son petit commerce fonctionne grâce à son accueil chaleureux, son expérience dans ce domaine et la clientèle qu'elle a acquise avec le temps. Cette dernière devient importante et là, elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en détail. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son petit fond de commerce pour diversifier sa marchandise (riz, sel, l'eau minérale, cartons de sucres, des savons,...), et pouvoir augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle réinvestira une partie de son bénéfice dans l’activité pour couvrir les besoins de son secteur et l'autre partie lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Louise is a 55 year old woman, and is a mother. She opened a food stall in a district of the capital, and has been managing it for the past two years. Her small business operates thanks to Louise's warmth in welcoming her customers, and her experience in this field. Louise has a faithful clientele that she has acquired over time.

However, Louise is no longer able to meet her customers' demand, and due to her lack of capital she is obliged to buy her merchandise at retail. She is requesting this loan to increase her business capital so that she can diversify her products (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, soaps,...), and increase her profit margin.

Louise plans to reinvest a portion of her earnings into her business, and the remainder will allow her to meet her daily needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of products for sale (rice, salt, mineral water, cartons of sugar, soaps,...).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 24 years old. She lives in Kutaisi district with her aunt and uncle. Teona requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Teona works at the local shop as a salesperson. Her aunt works in the restaurant as a waitress. They both earn small monthly salaries, which is the only source of living for the family. 

Teona is requesting a loan from Credo to start a family business. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With her loan,Teona will open an entertaining center. She will rent a room, renovate it as needed, and hire people who will be working as animators on private orders on call. There is not many of this kind of centers in Kutaisi district and Teona hopes this will help her to have a good numbers of clients. She will try to have all kinds of entertainments needed for birthdays or other celebrations to satisfy clients' needs and make her business successful. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and Teona will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to open an entertaining center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bread and ice cream of different flavors and varieties, such as popsicles and cones, among others.

loans.name: Bachuki

texts.en:
Bachuki is 32 years old. He lives in Lagodekhi District with his 27-year-old wife and two-year-old daughter. Several times, Bachuki requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Bachuki is working as an operator at the local petrol station, on a small, monthly salary. This is the only income for them and it’s rarely enough to feed the family.

Bachuki requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Bachuki has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With his credit, Bachuki will rent a vineyard. The vineyard that he wants to rent already has grapes growing, so he will not have any extra expenses. Bachuki will harvest grapes and sell them at the local markets, at a good price. He hopes this will increase his monthly income and he will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to rent a vineyard.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
This is the second loan for this borrower. Nasiba is an honest person and has a good credit story. She has run an animal husbandry business since 2003. There are 6 people in her family. She lives with her husband and her 4 children, both boys and girls. Her husband is a driver in Russia. 

Since last year Nasiba has been rebuilding her house, and there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. Her son is going to be married and she must finish all the building work before autumn. 

The 10,000 somoni loan that Nasiba is taking will be dedicated to buying some missing construction  materials for rebuilding her family house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for rebuilding her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and 20 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Noupagagnon  D Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON D sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans et 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le riz, le mais et le piment  avec  MARIAM au beau milieu de la photo position assise, Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et  payer les frais de labours  pour entretenir 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Noupagagnon D Group are all married women with an average age of 39 years and an average of three children. They are all living in traditional families in Kolokoba, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

The are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. The group is on their seventh agricultural loan with the institution, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Mariam (shown in the photo in the center of the front row), grows crops of peanuts, rice, corn and peppers among other things. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Mariam hopes to earn an average income of 200,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, tiene 4 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Félix  tiene un negocio de venta de fruta y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio hace 3 años con el objetivo de trabajar lo propio y generar sus propios ingresos.  Su negocio esta establecido en un pequeño lugar  en el centro del mercado donde exhibe los productos para que los clientes lleguen a comprar, vende de toda clase de verdura y fruta  fresca como tomate, chile, repollo, cebolla, rábano, yuca, jilotes, papas, limones, naranja, bananos, mangos, etc.  Manifiesta que las ventas son a diario ya que son productos que las amas de casa necesitan en el hogar.
Don Félix esta solicitando un cuarto préstamo por 6,000 lempiras, para comprar verduras y frutas frescas para la venta.  Como tomate, repollo, papas, yuca, Chile, banano, naranja, mangos, etc. Esta inversión piensa incrementar las ventas y la atención a los clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio para tener más volumen en las ventas y poder  tener un local acondicionado y fijo para su negocio.
texts.en:
57-year old Félix lives with his common-law wife and four children in the municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa. He has a business selling fruit and vegetables which he started three years ago as he wanted an income-generating business of his own. It is located in a small space in the centre of the market where customers can come see the produce. 

Félix sells many types of fresh fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, chilli peppers, cabbage, onions, radishes, yucca, young maize, potatoes, lemons, oranges, bananas, and mangoes. His stall is open every day as his customers need these products on a daily basis. He is now seeking his fourth loan of 6,000 lempiras to buy fresh fruit and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, yucca, chilli peppers, bananas, oranges, and mangoes. He believes that the loan will help him increase sales and provide better service.

His goals are to continue growing his business, make more sales, and have permanent premises in good repair.

loans.use: Buy a wide variety of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a member of a six-person group. She is a 42-year-old hardworking woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and three daughters. All of her children are studying in school. She and her husband have owned a fast food business for 5 years, which is the only source of income for their family. 

Now, for the further growth of their business, Naseem as a member of a six-person borrower group, has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. 

Their family expenditures are much higher compared to the monthly income and savings. Therefore Naseem wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profits. As a result they can increase their monthly income as well as their savings. She hopes for the higher education of her children. She is very thankful to Kiva for such great help and kindness. 

In the picture, Naseem is raising her hand.

loans.use: To expand the restaurant business.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio is a 49-year-old married man with seven children. He lives in Sibugon, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is successful with his farm, planting, harvesting and selling mango and products from other fruit trees. 

He became a member of GDMPC micro credit in 2011 and has now borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP, with which, in addition to his capital, he will buy a farm adjacent to his farm. He plans to use the new farm as an expansion of his current farming business.

loans.use: to buy a farm.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, as well as pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, and for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Melanie hopes to have another tricycle and dreams to give her children a good future. She meets with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for tricycle

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 46-year-old hard-working housewife. She loves in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a janitor by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to cover the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past six years, he has also been driving a taxi at night. But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open an auto mechanic shop in the future. Naseem desires to provide a quality education to her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: to meet the cost of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Dayae

texts.en: Dayae, age 46, is from Iraq. He is married and the father of four children. Dayae is the sole provider for his family. Dayae owns a small shop where sells mobile phones, recharge cards and mobile accessories such as headsets and mobile covers. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Dayae earned a good reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices and free maintenance services for his clients. Dayae is applying for a loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent on his shop. Dayae believes that this loan will give him a chance to expand his business and increase his profits and will give him the ability to take better care of his family and provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Nerie

texts.en: Nerie's main source of income comes from her gardening business. She is 48 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is from Bayabas, Aurora, and has been in gardening for three years, earning PHP 3,000 a month. Aside from this, she also raises piglets for sale. She recently applied for a loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to buy piglets to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Vakhtang

texts.en: 55-year-old Vakhtang lives in a small village, Nunisi, in Kharagauli district, with his wife Makvala. Vakhtang applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family owns a small agricultural plot, where nut trees are grown. They also have a booth, which is rented out for 100 GEL. Vakhtang has a car, and he drives it as a taxi to transport local people, to earn a small additional daily income. Vakhtang applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Vakhtang has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With his credit, Vakhtang will buy a milk cow. His wife will look after the cow and milk it every day to produce dairy products. The products will be sold at the market and among the villagers. Vakhtang hopes this will help him to earn more income for the family. He wants to try to expand his agriculture business in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Haind

texts.en: Haind is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Hodeida, Yemen. She is a kind woman who offers great opportunities to students. She is a teacher who is paid a low salary. She is not as interested in getting money, as she is in focusing on educating students. She thinks this career serves society. She lives with her family in a bad situation, and she intends to buy construction supplies to use for her small house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. She hopes to improve her living standards with this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use to improve her a small house.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena  tiene 41 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 9 años que se encuentra en edad escolar,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Chasquipampa,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Elena enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is 41 years old, married, and has two children aged 8 and 9 who attend school. She sells basic food items from her corner store located in the Chasquipampa area. This is her first loan with the institution and she plans to use it to buy merchandise such as groceries, candy, and soft drinks to sell in the store. These items are much in demand and more sales will be generated. The challenge Elena faces is competition from the several stores in the area.

She will use the profits to buy more merchandise as stock for the store and continue expanding. Her wish is to see a thriving business and a well-stocked store so that her income will increase and she can provide a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: Buy stock for her corner store

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo y por la facilidad que la Institución brinda; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas para el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar los ingresos y con ello logro apoyar a su familia; las  condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Julio needs to obtain a new loan because he requires more working capital. Our institution offers him easy payment terms. This loan will allow him to purchase fertilizer, weed killers, insecticides, and pesticides for his crops.

The previous loan helped him improve his income, which allowed him to support his family. His financial situation and family circumstances have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killers, insecticides, and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal is a from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married, and has three children. Hilal works to provide an income for his family all by himself, while his wife takes care of their children.

Hilal is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. He provides his neighborhood with basic family staples such as canned food, dairy products, snacks, and detergents. He has been in this field since 2005 and gained his experience through hard work. Hilal has a hired employee and is well known for his knowledge of the market.

Hilal is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy a refrigerator, to install aluminum shelves, and to increase his inventory. Hilal aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to educate his children and provide them a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, install aluminum shelves and increase inventory

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 55 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his wife, Lali, his 20-year-old son, and his retired mother. 

Several times, Eldar requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Eldar is trading with fruits and vegetables. He has a counter at the local market, where the products are sold. His wife is working at the local food factory, as a cook. The family's additional income comes from Eldar’s mother’s monthly pension. 

Eldar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Eldar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.
